Being a widow is not a hindrance for her to achieve her dreams.  She needs to be diligent and determined to overcome every difficulties of life. She remains a fighter and tries not to be a loser for every test of time.

Through her hog raising business, Cherley was able to cope up with their daily needs.  her need of business capital encourages her to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 15,000.00.  She will use the money to buy feeds supply for the maintenance of her business for her to further support the education of her children.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Kemea

texts.fr:
Cette femme a emboîté le pas de sa mère en exerçant dans la restauration, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, elle sert spécialement des plats togolais, beaucoup de monde vient déjeuner chez  elle, elle exerce à proximité d’un bar ce qui lui permet de bénéficier de la clientèle du bar. Son stock de produits nécessaires à la restauration est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite donc un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des vivres et divers condiments pour son activité de restauration.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants
texts.en:
This is a woman who has followed in her mother's footsteps operating a restaurant business. She has been in this business since 1999, and she especially serves Togolese dishes. Many people come to her for lunch. She operates near a bar, which allows her to benefit from its customers. Her stock of the necessary ingredients is exhausted. She wants to stock up again and is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy provisions and various condiments for her food service business. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying necessary ingredients for food catering

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
ADELIA P. of Sitio Kalayugan, Brgy. Sampinit, Bago City, Negros Occidental is a 67 year-old widow with 6 adult children.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 so that she could financially contribute to her adult children. Since she is a good cook she decided to set up a business selling specialty food products in her community and has done quite well in her venture as it earns her PHP 8,000 per month on the average.

For her 16th loan cycle, Adelia wants to borrow PHP 6,000.00 to add to her working capital so that she could offer a wider variety to her customers.

Adelia works hard in her business because she does not want to be a financial burden to her children in her golden years. 


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL WORKING CAPITAL FOR THE BORROWER

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites N. is a hardworking woman residing in the simple village of Sili Aurora, Isabela. She is married to Salvador N. who is a farmer and a jeepney transport (small bus) driver. Their major source of income comes from the production of rice and vegetables on their farm. Marites sells the vegetables harvested in their vegetable farming whereas their harvested rice is kept for their stock of rice for the whole year.

Marites used to sell their vegetable produce at a wholesale price in their public market. Because she wanted their farming to improve and because she wanted her vending to expand further, Marites is requesting PHP 15,000 from Kiva to use as additional capital to also buy their neighbors’ produce to sell.

Marites’ desire is to continue to support the college education of her two children which motivates her to improve her vegetable production and vending business to increase her income. This way, Marites will assure her children an education and satisfy them in their daily basic needs.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is already 58 years old. She manages a general store business in their simple village of Siempre Viva Sur Mallig, Isabela. She is married to Melecio Berbol, 56 years old, whose occupation is farming. They are blessed with four children who all have their own families now.

Milagros continues to dream of a good quality of life with her supportive husband and the assistance of Kiva from whom she is requesting PHP 25,000 as additional business capital to improve her store.

Furthermore, Milagros also maintains a hog-raising business at the moment. She is not losing her hope that someday she will achieve all her goals in life thru hard work, strong determination, and faith in God. She is a determined entrepreneur, doing all her best for the welfare of her family and the education of her future grandchildren.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely helps her husband manage their furniture-making business. Her husband, Dorio, is very hardworking and that makes her very proud. They are blessed with three children, namely: Jimmy, Juvie and Ofela. Fely is happy that she has a family that is very cooperative with each other. Her eldest is now working in Manila as food-chain crew, the second child is helping them in their furniture business, while the youngest is still in college.

Fely also manages being a direct seller of Avon products in their village to earn extra income for their daily needs. She is hoping that her family will become successful in their individual goals to achieve the welfare of their family in the future. Fely also supports her children’s ambitions in life and thus lets them do what they think is best for themselves.

To provide for the development of good and quality furniture products, Fely is asking financial help from Kiva amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is requesting PHP 14,000 from kiva lenders. She manages a general store business that is very helpful in sustaining her daily basic needs. She is now 61 years old and is married to a farmer in the person of Francisco S., 62 years of age. The couple is still strong in doing their business successfully despite their retiring age.

Due to difficulties of life, they were not able to provide their children with a college education but they are thankful that all of them are very responsible and made their way to a better living by gambling their fate in Manila where they all now live. There they find their jobs as factory workers while one is in abroad working as a domestic helper.

Elena is also saving for whatever happenings that will occur in their following days. She wants everything to be secured. Thus, she is working very hard with the support of her husband.

loans.use: To use for business improvement

loans.name: Anida

texts.en:
Anida is the owner of a furniture-making business in the rural village of Catabban Burgos, Isabela. With her income from the said business, Anida is able to support her family needs at home and in school where she sends her children. She is already 45 years old and is happily married to Jose L., 47 years old.

Anida, on the other hand, also manages a direct selling business of Avon products in their village where she earns a 25% commission for every PP 100 worth of sold products. Her business commission is a big help and, together with their income from their furniture-making business, they are able to continue to send their five children to school.

The couple dreams that their children will successfully finish their education and will have a good future someday. Thus, trying all their best to comply with their responsibilities as good parents to their children and to do this further, Anida is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva to support the progress of their furniture-making business.

loans.use: To support the progress of their furniture-making business

loans.name: Meminetou

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son mari est un fonctionnaire. Pour aider son époux dans les dépenses du foyer elle a entamé le commerce de céréales. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays. Elle réalise de bonnes recettes tous les jours. Voulant agrandir son stock, elle sollicite un crédit  pour acheter 10 sacs d’haricots, 10 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs de sorgho et 1 sac de mil. Avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra vendre plus.
texts.en:
This is a married lady and the mother of two. Her husband is a civil servant. To help him with household expenses, she began a business in grains. She gets her stock from the country's interior. Every day, she brings in a good income. Wanting to enlarge her inventory, she is requesting a loan to buy ten sacks of beans, ten sacks of corn, four of sorghum, and one of millet. With this new inventory, she will be able to sell more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married to Angelito A. and they are fortunately blessed with an only child named Owen Angelo. He is now 8 years old and is currently attending the elementary level of education. Her husband is operating a passenger transport business where most of the passengers are students going to and from their village to school in their town proper. Rowena is engaged in a typical village store business. She provides most of their daily basic necessities at home while some of her income was used to send her children to school. She is thankful for having her business beneficial to her family needs, and she hopes to sustain the business for their growing needs, especially when her two children go to college. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman and give her children a better future someday. 

She is requesting additional business capital for her store from Kiva. She hopes to improve her business and sustain it for the future welfare of her children. She knows that being patient and working hard are the keys to a successful enterprise, thus Rowena keeps doing her best to able meet the standards in managing business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a loving housewife to Ernesto C.. She is already 58 years old and is a resident of Barangay Siempre Viva Sur Mallig, Isabela. She also was serving as Barangay Kagawad (the village council leader) in their community. Farming is their main source of living. Hog raising is part of their income that is maintained by Erlinda. Through the business, they were able to continue sening their four children to school, and she is hoping that someday they will finish their studies in college. At present, the couple is really trying hard to the best of their knowledge to have additional business capital to achieve their goals in life and to uplift their poor living situation. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will lend her the amount to further maintain the needs of food and supplies for her pig-raising business.

loans.use: food, supplies for pig raising

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a hardworking hog -aiser at her early 30 years of age. She is married to Jose B., who is a farmer. They produce rice and vegetables from their farming, which is their family major source of income in the village of Siempre Viva Sur Mallig, Isabela. Lack of business capital was the reason why Fe wanted to join the Kiva loan program. She is requesting to borrow the amount to buy enough supplies and feed for her hog raising and to buy at least one added piglet to further develop her business in terms of size.

loans.use: feed, supplies and a piglet for pig raising

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a widow who lives happily together with her family in the village of Siempre Viva Sur in Mallig, Isabela. Delia is a type of person who never gives up in achieving her dreams in life. She patiently maintains her hog-raising business to further develop a good business and become successful somehow. She is requesting to borrow from Kiva as additional business capital. Delia is hoping to give her children a better future by sustaining her current business and eventually getting into other types of businesses that would be of great help to her family.

Moreover, Delia is blessed with four children as the fruit of her love with her husband. Now, their two children already has their own jobs at the moment, though they are not college graduates, while two of them have successfully finished their college education through her hard work and patience in her hog raising. She was glad that since the death of her husband due to vehicle accident, she has successfully given her children with better living opportunities. Because of her dream to become a successful entrepreneur, she is requesting the assistance of Kiva loans.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
To uplift their living situation from the quagmire of poverty is the main dream of Winnie C., a hog -aising entrepreneur in the village of Siempre Viva Sur Mallig, Isabela. She is already 47 years old. She always believes that unity, patience and hard work are needed to become successful in life. She solely manages her four children since she is already a widow of her late husband Normito, who died due to cardiac arrest. Being a mother and a family breadwinner, Winnie said it is not a hindrance if she works diligently and is determined to overcome every difficulty of life. She remains a fighter and tries not to be a loser in the tests of time.

By managing a small hog-raising business, Winnie is able to cope with some of their necessities. However, because of the lack in finances, she wants to ask for the assistance of Kiva lenders to buy the supply of feed that her business needs and to be able to continue her support in the education of her children.

loans.use: pig feed

loans.name: Meyevi

texts.fr:
revendeuse de bijoux de qualité, cette femme achète ses bijoux de cotonou et les revend ensuite à Lomé et au burkina-faso, les bijoux qu’elle vend au burkina faso sont plus coûteux que ceux vendus à Lomé ainsi elle arrive à couvrir son déplacement, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de pagnes et de tissus. Elle a reçu une commande de ses clients du burkina faso, pour les satisfaire elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un ensemble de bijoux de grande qualité.
Elle est mariée et a 01 enfant.
texts.en:
This woman sells quality jewelry. She purchases her jewelry from Cotonou and sells it in Lome and Burkina Fasso. Because the jewelry she sells in Burkina Fasso is more expensive than the jewelry sold in Lome, she is able to cover her travel costs. She has also begun selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African cloth) and fabric. She has received an order from her clients in Burkina Fasso and to fill the order, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchanse a set of quality jewelry. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of jewelry, pagnes and fabric

loans.name: Victoria Bulasa's Group

texts.en:
V. is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 48-year-old married woman with five children in ages ranging from 20 to 28 years. Three of her children go to school. She resides and owns a four-room house where she is staying with ten people. V. takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.  

V. stays in Nsooba running a pub, selling only sodas and other cold drinks, excluding beer, in one of the Kampala suburbs. She doesn’t incur any extra transportation cost as she buys from her region. V. sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and daily market dues and rent. She has been in this business for the last ten years. V. has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her fourteenth loan, working all this long with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of sodas. V. is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business premise and home 

.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’adidogomé où elle réside avec son mari et ses 04 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. Elle exerce son commerce dans le marché local d’adidogomé. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, elle veut augmenter son stock et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes «hi-target » et 10 pièces de pagnes « soso ».
texts.en:
This woman lives in the district of Adidogomé with her husband and four children. She is earning an income by selling colourful traditional fabrics called "pagnes". She runs her business in a local market in Adidogomé. Her clientele is increasing every day and she would like to increase her stock. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 15 pieces of "Hi-Target" brand fabric and 10 pieces of "Soso" brand fabric.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
VIRGINIA M. is 59 years old, married with 9 adult children and a resident of Brgy. Dulao, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

Virginia owns and operates a small business cooking food to sell to members of her community. This earns her PHP 4,500.00 per month.

Even as she approaches "senior citizenship", Virginia is determined to be financially independent and this is the reason why she wants to continue expanding her business. For her 15th loan cycle, she wants to borrow PHP 11,000.00 to add to her working capital so that she could offer more products to her ever growing number of loyal customers. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL CAPITAL

loans.name: Mrs. Lim Art Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people living in Pratheat village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Lim A. is the 45-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Choeuy S. Ly, is a musician who is hired for wedding ceremonies. Now Mrs. Lim A. is requesting a loan to repair her family's house. She has seven children, three of whom are working in a garment factory, three are attending the local school and one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Saidat Muyanja ‘S Group

texts.en:
Saidat is the leader of four members of a group.  She is a 40-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 10 and 21 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-room house where she is staying with five people. Saidat takes care of additional family members.  There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Saidat stays in Nalukolongo selling bananas in Nalukolongo Market, in one of Kampala suburbs.  She doesn’t incur any extra transport cost as she buys from her place of work.  Saidat sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and daily market dues.  She has been in this business for the last ten years. Saidat has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her 14th loan, working all this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy to more bananas. Saidat aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise. 

.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Cette femme a ouvert en 2004 une boutique de vente de produits pharmaceutiques et des produits génériques. Son stock de produits pharmaceutiques a connu une baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier cycle de prêt pour rehausser son stock de produits pharmaceutiques.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Avec son revenu elle contribue aux dépenses de son foyer.
texts.en:
In 2004, this woman opened a store selling pharmaceutical and generic products. Her stock has depleted so she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to re-stock her generic products. She is married and has one child. With her income she contributes to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of pharmaceutical and generic products

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
MRS. ELNA P. is 43 years old, married with 3 children and a resident of Purok Paglaum, Brgy Atipuluhan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon 12 years ago, she learned that poverty is not a hindrance to success and she lived by these words - she strived harder in order to improve her family's quality of life.

She started by selling a variety of delicacies and later ventured into pig fattening to supplement her income. Now on her 14th loan cycle, Elna is borrowing PHP 15,000.00 to buy more piglets to raise and sell.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL CAPITAL FOR HER HOG RAISING VENTURE

loans.name: Манзура

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Манзура женщина –кредитор в организации более шести лет. Она жительница Костакоза, занимается продажей нижнего белья, детской одежды и обуви на рынке Костакоза. Для завоза школьного ассортимента детской одежды она планирует  съездить в Бишкек. На снимке Манзура на месте деятельности.

loans.use: продажа  детской одежды

loans.name: Муротали

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Муротали 49 лет, отец пятерых детей. Опытный животновод. Он с молодости пасёт скот, и хорошо разбирается в них. На каждый свой кредит он увеличивает скот. Сейчас  у несколько десятков коз. Его жена производит белую козью пряжу. Он благодарит инвесторов за поддержку и понимание.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Зульфизар

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Зульфизар девушка 25 лет , замужем имеет одного ребёнка. Она проживает в Сомгаре , в посёлке Карочингиль. Зульфизар производит пряжу на дому, одновременно ухаживает за скотом. Сейчас у неё две коровы и бараны. На полученный кредит Зульфизар планирует с мужем, купит ещё несколько баранов и корм для них.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
HELEN B. of Purok Tisa, Hacienda Libertad, Brgy. Mailum, Bago City, Negros Occidental is 31 years old, married with 3 school-age children.

When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon 5 years ago, she invested the capital she borrowed by setting up as store that sells plastic wares, Ready-to-Wear Clothes, Shoes and accessories, and this earns a profit of approximately PHP 4,000.00 per month.

Now with all her 3 children going to school (Grade 1, 2 & 6) she needs to supplement her income from her retail business to pay for the additional expenses that this development entails. This is the reason why Helen thought of purchasing livestock to raise and sell to augment the income she earns from her main business.

Borrowing PHP 19,500.00 from NWTF-Project Dungganon for her 10th loan cycle, Helen intends to set aside the money she earns from the livestock venture for the educational needs of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: PURCHASE LIVESTOCK TO RAISE AND SELL

loans.name: Равшан

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Усмонова Равшан жительница посёлка Карочингиль,  занимается откормом и продажей скота. В основном ё неё мелкорогатый скот, козы и бараны. На следующий очередной кредит она планирует купить несколько голов  баранов и сена для них.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Ахрорходжа

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ахрорходжа мужчина 23 лет, женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Он мастер по евроремонту квартир.  Его работа сезонная, поэтому он имеет постоянный дополнительный доход с бизнеса откорма и продажи скота. Для увеличения скота Ахрорходжа решил получить кредит в «Арванде». Его устараивают условия организации  и он скоро получит кредит

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Тахмина

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Тахмина женщина 28 лет, проживает в Костакозе. Вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей скота. Её муж работает водителем такси, поэтому в основно ухаживает его жена. Тахмина решила получить кредит для расширения семейного бизнеса.  Она хочет купить пару дойных коров и  корм для них.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Самебой

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Самебой мужчина  59 лет, занимается откормом и продажей мелкого скота. Он работает арендатором в колхозе. Для закупа несколько голов баранов Самебой хочет получить повторный очередной кредит. Самебой доволен кредитованием, потому что его семейное положение улучшилось и прибыль увеличилась.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Мархабо

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мархабо женщина 31 года , которая третий год кредитуется в наше организации. Она проживает в Костакозе и занимается вместе с мужем уходом за скотом.  Кроме этого Мархабо работает в колхозе , но вместо денег её дают продукты питания.  Она  пунктуально работает с организацией. Планирует купить корм для коров и ещё пару молодых бычков.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Биизат

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Худойдотова Биизат  девушка, которой 20 лет. Она помогает отцу по уходу за скотом. Её отец занимается  откормом и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Биизат хочет сделать свой небольшой вклад в бизнес отца и иметь свою прибыль . На полученный кредит она планирует купить три коровы дающие молоко.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Насим

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Насимчон молодой человек , который второй год кредитуется в организации. Займ берёт для расширения бизнеса животноводства. Сам работает разнорабочим по изготовлению глиняных кирпичей на заказ. Он планирует на следующий  займ, закупить  несколько голов баранов .

loans.use: откорм и продажа  скота

loans.name: Абдурахим

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Абдурахим мужчина 23 лет, проживает в Костакозе, занимается откормом и продажей молодого мелкого скота, баранов. Он кредитор в организации больше года. За год кредитования его оборотный капитал заметно увеличился. Также жизнь улучшилась из-за дополнительной прибыли. На следующий кредит Абдурахим хочет купить шесть породистых баранов.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Immacule

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Immacule, a 56-year-old married woman with six children of the following ages: 20, 18, 16, 14, 10 and 9 years old. This big family lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur owns a general store in Nyarugenge district where she sells different kinds of merchandise such as beans, rice, cooking oil, etc. Mrs. M. had been doing the same business since 2003. She obtains a monthly profit of $275 and has one full time worker that helps her run the business. She starts her daily operations at 8:00 AM and ends at 8:00 PM. Immacule is seeking her first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company S.A and with this loan, she intends to buy more products to increase her store.
With the increased profit from the loan, she hopes to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for the store

loans.name: Sokhna Diarra

texts.fr: sokhna diarra S. evolue dans la vente d'habillement depuis deux(02)ans.celibataire sans enfants elle a une grande experience dans le domaine du commerce.elle sollicite un credit de deux cent(200 000)frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement et afin de repondre ala demande croissante de sa clientele.
texts.en:
Sokhna Diarra S. has been developing her business selling clothes for 2 years. Single and without children, she has a large amount of business experience. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to increase her working capital and so to respond to the growing demand from her customers.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Greetings from Mrs. K. Rose. She is a 56-year-old widow with two children of the following ages: 30 and 24 years old. She lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur operates her business in her home where she makes outfits and other types of clothes and repairs clothes. This entrepreneur had been doing the same business since 1999. She starts her daily operations at 8:00 PM and finishes at 11:00 PM. She obtains approximately $185 a month and she has hired one employee who helps her run the business.

Rose is seeking her first loan worth 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company S.A, the partner of World Vision Rwanda. With the loan, Rose will buy more tissue and cloth to make outfits and she hopes to continue expanding the business with the increased profit from the loan.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: coumba M. est societaire de la caisse de baye laye depuis fevrier 2008.elle a deja beneficie de deux(02)prets au sein de l'institution .actuellement elle sollicite un credit de deux cent cinquante mille(250 000)frs pour renforcer son capital au niveau de la commercialisation de legumes secteur dans le lequel il evolue depuis quelques annees.son objectif est de subvenir a ses besios familliaux avec l'augmentation de ses revenus.
texts.en:
Coumba M. has been a member of the Baye Laye bank since February 2008. She already benefited from 2 loans from this institution. She's now seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 to bolster her capital. For a few years, she's been selling vegetables. Her goal is to increase her income in order to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a cheerful, welcoming woman whom I met last week while she was serving lunch at the house for which she and her family are the caretakers.  Norma has a variety of business ventures.  On Sundays, she sells barbecued meats from her home in the small town of Yarinacocha, a suburb of the city of Pucallpa.  She hopes to invest this loan of 1000 soles in used clothing, which she will exchange for food grown in the small communities along the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  Norma will then sell these agricultural products in Pucallpa.

Norma and her family (her husband and their two daughters, aged 15 and 24) are the caretakers for a home and office building near the center of the city of Pucallpa.  They live there during the week.  Norma serves lunch in her kitchen every weekday to a variety of regular customers.  Norma's husband works as a regional representative for a security company.  

Norma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for more than eight years.  She has used past loans to purchase a sewing machine and sewing materials.  Norma used to do clothing repairs and sew undergarments and children's clothing.  She has not been able to engage in this work recently due to an eye operation but hopes to begin again by September, at which time her eye is expected to be fully healed.  

Norma very much appreciates her loans from Manuela Ramos.  She told me that these loans help women to become independent, and to feel that they are strong and are contributing to society.  With the establishment of their own businesses, women no longer have to wait for their husbands' paychecks.

Norma's goal is to keep working in order to continue paying for her youngest daughter's education.  She wants to enable her daughter to go to college and have a professional career.  She also wants to be able to do some repair work on her house.  Norma is pictured here in her kitchen, where she had been preparing lunch for that day's customers.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to exchange for food to sell

loans.name: Edgar Wilmer

texts.es: El señor Edgar es un cliente que esta en su segunda secuencia, al transcurrir su primer credito demostro que es un cliente responsable y puntual, solo tuvo un dia de atraso y fue por viaje del cliente, él actualmente esta formando su patrimonio , el actualmente no esta casado pero el cuenta que todo su trabajo es para darle a su futura familia un buen patrimonio, se vio que el señor tiene una buena solvencia moral y tambien se pudo evidenciar que el cliente tiene un buen caracter, social  y amigable, el destino del credito es la reparacion de su movilidad, el cliente comenta que su movilidad esta con problemas de motor, la reparacion le costara el prestamo.
texts.en:
El señor Edgar is a customer in his second loan phase. In his first phase, he demonstrated he is a responsible and punctual customer. He had only one day that a payment was late and that was because he was traveling. He is now forming his patrimony. He is not now married but says that all his work is to give his future family a good patrimony. One saw that he had a good moral resolve, and also one can bear witness that the customer has a good character, social and friendly. This loan will be used for the repair of his vehicle. The customer says that the motor of his vehicle has problems; the repair will cost the amount of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is engaged in a variety of interesting business ventures.  She's maD. good use of her loans over the past 10 years while working with Kiva's partner, Manuela Ramos.

Silvia has a large garage area on her property where she stores motorcycle taxis overnight for a fee.  Silvia has been fixing this area by improving the pavement and installing better walls. She also has Balto, an affectionate hairless dog (native to Peru), to help guard the taxis at night.

Silvia also owns two fishing boats.  She keeps one boat on the Ucayali River (a wiD., brown river that eventually joins the Amazon). Silvia has used recent loans to purchase necessary boat supplies, including a motor, fishing net, etc. The boat is used up to five days at a time. When it returns, Silva and the crew share the earnings from fish sales. Silvia earns between 800 to 2000 soles (about $265-$665) each time the boat returns, depending on the catch. Silvia also keeps another smaller fishing boat on the lake in the town of Yarinacocha, where she lives. Silvia's fishing enterprise is going well.  Summer is the best season for catching fish.

Silvia requests a 3000 soles loan.  Half will be used to purchase another net maD. of a heavier material; better for fishing in the winter season.  The rest will be used to improve her garage.

Silvia is married and has two adult daughters and three grandsons. One daughter and two grandsons live with her.

Silvia is the treasurer of her communal bank, "Teresa Ramos."  She has worked very well with Manuela Ramos, advancing "slowly but surely," in her words.  Several years ago she and another woman were chosen by Manuela Ramos to attend a workshop in Lima.  Over 250 Manuela Ramos borrowers from around the country attended this several-day-long conference to discuss their businesses and learn more about Manuela's future projects.

loans.use: Improve her garage and buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells foodstuff at Atabadi near Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Mary has received no formal education.  She has been selling foodstuff since 2006. She is responsible for buying food for her home. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuff to increase sales and expand the business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a single parent with three children. She has a senior high school education. Esi sells plastic bowls at Esaman near Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Esi uses her income to pay for the education of the children. Esi will use the loan to purchase more plastic products for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to pay fees.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic products for resale

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a widow and 37 years old. She has 3 children ages 20, 16 and 12 and one dependent.

She needs her first loan of 500000 RWF from VISION FINANCE COMPANY S.A to buy oil and fish to resell. Jacqueline has 10 years of experience doing that business and works from 6 A.M to 7 P.M. daily.

Jacqueline earns about $500 per month. The loan will help her expand her business. With the profits she will be able to pay school fees for her children and dependent.

loans.use: Buy oil and fish.

loans.name: Laadi

texts.en: Laadi A. is married and has four dependents. She has a primary school education. Laadi sells groundnut and maize at the new market Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a driver. Laadi uses her income to pay for school fees. Laadi will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Laadi plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. is married and has five dependents. She has received schooling through senior high school. Agnes sells fresh fish in Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a tailor. Agnes uses her income to support her husband by paying school fees. Agnes will use the loan to purchase more fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en: George A. sells fish on the beach in Elmina. He owns a track which he uses for the distribution of his fish. George has a senior high school education. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. George has been selling fish since 2000. He is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. His loan will be used to buy more fish for resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Margarette

texts.en:
Margarette is a 60-year-old mother of six. A few years ago, she decided that she had to take a stronger role in providing for her family. As a result, she joined GHAPE in order to help her achieve this goal. Responding to this challenge, she started her own businesses and invested in developing her family farm. 

Having already been a member of GHAPE for almost eight years now, Margarette has engaged in a number of different money making enterprises. She has sold cocoyams, and has also bought a motorcycle to help her transport her goods to market. With the profits of each of these ventures, Margarette has spent the money on her children’s school fees and has also used this money to be able to feed and clothe the rest of her family. With the profits of her last loan, she also was able to bury her husband. 

With this next loan, Margarette is looking to start a tire patching business in Ntarikon, a neighbourhood of Bamenda Cameroon. This tire patching business will succeed because of her collaboration with her first born son, a very energetic young man, and also because of her good business location. In addition to this, she feels that her tenacity, a trait learned over years of raising her children all by herself, will also provide her business with strength and vitality in the years to come. 

Through this, she then will benefit the community in providing tire repair service, and will also be able to save people a significant amount of money over the full price of a new tire. Through the success of this venture, Margarette will also be able to put money directly back into the community through spending and employing other community members in the future. 

Margarette first came to GHAPE because of the quality of their training in business management, and also because of the low interest and easy payment plan. Through the success of these, she has become financially independent and has also been able to help some of her children start businesses of their own. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of working tools for tire patching, marketing

loans.name: Ambe

texts.en:
Ambe S. is a 46 year old mother of four. She lives in Nchuabu, a neighborhood in Bamenda, Cameroon, and makes her living selling produce in the food market. In the past she has sold potatoes and coco yams, using the profit to buy more food, pay school fees and medication for her family.

With this next loan, Ambe will continue in the same vein; selling potatoes and coco yams. She also plans to sell plums. She will make a personal contribution of 50,000 fCFA to make sure that this business succeeds, but she is also looking for a loan to supplement this amount.

Her business plan is to purchase goods in bulk and resell them in the Bamenda market in small quantities at a decent profit. This plan will be coupled with S.’s experience in selling goods in the market. Her children will be there to help her.

S. will sell nutritious food to the people in the market at a lower price, and she will be able to reduce the distance traveled for people to be able to find food of similar qualities. S. came to GHAPE because of the agreeable terms on loans, such as no collateral and low interest rates. She has come to love the organization because of the training and help received to help make her business a success.

--------------------------------- The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, Ibo coco yams and plums.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es: Las Señoras de Santa Rita comunidad lejana de la Poblaciòn de Nahualà Sololà Guatamala, se han reunido para tener apoyo ya que en ese lugar los Bancos no les apoyan por ser un lugar lejano y personas de escasos recursos y estas 11 personas, han trabajado siempre con una cantidad minima para sus capitales ya que ellas apoyan a sus esposos y otras que son madres solteras y sacan abante a sus hijos e hijas ellas se dedica a la fabricaciòn de guipiles tipicos y venta  de ropa tipica que viajan en un lugar a otro ofreciendo su producto de modo para poder sobrevivir y si se ve la necesidad de apoyarlas y Ellas han pedido siempre la ayuda de la Asociaciòn ASDIR, para seguir trabajando y apoyando a incrementar sus capitales de las señoras de Santa Rita para mejorar sus nivel de vida y sobre salir para ellas tambien apoyen a sus hijos en las ecuelas y poder superar.
texts.en:
The women of Santa Rita, a remote community of Poblaciòn de Nahualà Sololà Guatemala, have joined together to get support. In this place the banks do not help them because they are in a remote area. They have scant resources. These 11 people have always worked with a minimum amount of capital. Some help their husbands, and others are single mothers. They support their children. They make “guipiles” (traditional blouses) and typical clothing. They travel from one place to another selling their products in order to survive. They have always asked the ASDIR Association for help to keep working and increasing their capital. The women of Santa Rita need help to improve the quality of their lives and improve themselves. They also support their children’s education and their ability to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: El Progreso De Manguito: Grupo 7 Group

texts.en:
Laura S. is 38 years old and serves as the president of her five-member solidarity group, El Progreso D. Manguito. The group is taking out its second loan through Esperanza International. Laura is a mother of four and lives in a barrio of the Dominican Republic’s capital, Santo Domingo. She plans to use her second loan to expand her door-to-door clothing sales business. Her customers have been asking for more clothing, with a particular emphasis on shoes, so she looks forward to providing her customers with more merchandise. Looking ahead, she aims to continue taking out loans from Esperanza in the future to increase her inventory further and reach new neighborhoods.

Pictured above is “Progreso”: (l-r) Silvia, Ynocencia, Victoria, Laura and Francesca.

loans.use: Clothes inventory expansion (esp. shoes)

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: G. Jeanette is 25 years old. She is married to a husband who gains 1000 USD per month and she has two children and four dependents. She needs her first loan of 600,000 in order to improve her daily DAIRY business. She is experienced for four years in her business and she employs six people who start at 6 30 A.M and finish at 11 P.M.  She gains 1000 USD.  The reason why she needs a loan is to expand her business and her monthly income in order to be able to support her family and accomplish some other responsibilities.

loans.use: Milk

loans.name: Marta Magdalena

texts.es: La señora Marta Magdalena I. C.  se ha dedicado a trabajar en la venta de ropa tipica por unos 12 años atras y con este siempre a sobre salido y apoyado a sus hijas  para poder sobresalir y esto a servido como sustento cotidiano,la señora Marta viendo su necesidad para poder aumentar sus ingresos ve la necesidad de acudir a la Asociaciòn ASDIR, ya que ella ha tenido la certeza que la asociaciòn le apoya ya que en otras entidades o Bancos no le prestan ese apoyo que ella necesita por la minima cantidad que la señora Marta I. requiere para el capital, y asi tener otro nivel de ingreso y de vida; ya que ella vela por sus hijas por ser madre soltera y no tiene apoyo de sus progenitores.
texts.en:
Marta Magdalena I. C. has sold typical clothing for 12 years. She has always done well in this work, and she has helped her daughters to be able to do well. Her business has provided them with their daily sustenance. Marta sees the necessity to increase her income. That is why she comes to the ASDIR Association. She is certain that the Association will help her. Other entities or banks do not lend her the support she needs for the minimal amount of capital that she needs. With a loan, she would have a higher level of income and a better quality of life. She is a single mother raising her daughters. She does not have help from their fathers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Makare

texts.fr: makare N. est recemment societaire a la caisse de baye laye.son activite principale est celle de tailleur.mais elle evolue aussi dans le domaine du transport.c'est un pere de famille qui veut developper son activite a travers la vente d'habits cousus pour mieux assister sa famille.elle sollicite un credit de deux cent mille(200 000)frs.
texts.en:
Nakare Nang has recently become a member of the lending bank of Baye Laye. He mainly works as a tailor. But he is developing in the transport domain. This father of a family wants to develop his business through sales in stitched clothing in order to assist his family further. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investments

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from K. EMMANUEL. He is a 31-year-old married man. His family has no children. He lives in the Kicukiro district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur does his business in Kicukiro district where he sells milk at both retail and in big quantities. Mr. K. Emmanuel has been doing the same business since 2000 and he obtains a monthly profit of $185. He has three full-time workers who help him to run his business and he starts his daily operations at 6:00 AM and finishes at 8:00 PM.
K. Emmanuel is seeking his first loan worth 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company S.A and with this loan, he intends to buy a lot of milk. With the increased profit from the loan, he hopes to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To purchase milk

loans.name: Ajpop Group

texts.es: El grupo Ajpop de la comunidad de Pacoxom, del Municipio de Nahualà departamento de Sololà acudieron a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para poder apoyar a estas señoras trabajadoras y ella pidieron un prestamo grupal, ya que ellas expusieron su situaciòn, precaria de sus economia ya que en otros bancos no les ayudan por ser personas de escasos recuersos porque tiene casas sencillas, y Ellas quieren salir abante ya que ven la necesidad de vender màs  pero no poseen suficiente  capital lo que se requiere en la inversiòn de compra de ropa y venderlos porteriormente, para sostenimiento de ellas mismas y de sus hijos y asi tener una mejor vida y poder superar esa crisis financiera y poder tener un nivel de vida mejor;porque en esa àrea de Nahualà el nivel de pobleza es demasiado alta y pàrsonas buscan la manera de sobre salir.
texts.en:
The Ajpop group of Pacoxom community, Municipality of Nahualà, Sololà Department attended the ASDIR Association to support these female workers and asked for a group loan. They presented them with their precarious economic situation because other banks do not help them because they are poor people with simple houses. They want to emerge as they see the need to sell more but do not have enough capital required to purchase and sell clothing. They want to sustain themselves and their children, overcome this financial crisis and have a better standard of living because in Nahualà the poverty level is too high and people are looking for a way out.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Implementation of Capital

loans.name: Devota

texts.en:
Greetings from B. DEVOTA, a 40-year-old married woman with eight children born in 1992, 1994, 1996, 1998, 2000, 2002, 2004, and 2006 and 12 dependents. This big family lives in Kicukiro district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur does her business in Kicukiro where she sells her food. B. Devota has been doing the same business since 2000 and she obtains a monthly profit of $272. She has twelve full-time workers that help her run her business. She starts her daily operations at 9:00 AM and finishes at 9:00 PM.


B. Devota is seeking her first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company SA and with this loan, she intends to buy a lot materials. With the increased profit from the loan, she hopes to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es:
DON BOSCO

Alcancía comunal conformada por diez personas, todos ellos se dedican al comercio minorista. Desde hace tres años y medio sus integrantes trabajan con EDAPROSPO - PROSPERIDAD, con los préstamos que recibieron durante este tiempo, lo invirtieron en su negocio cada uno con objetivos distintos. Mirian Blanca C. A. quien es presidenta del grupo tiene una pequeña chacra en el pueblo de Vicas (Huarochiri), tierra que fue donada por su madre. Ella cultiva tubérculos de acuerdo a la temporada como son: alfalfa, choclo, habas, papas y arvejas; con este negocio mantuvo a su familia, educó a sus hijos en el colegio, dado que sola afrontó con esta responsabilidad después de haber terminado la relación con su esposo.
Durante ese tiempo que trabajó ahorró un capital que invirtió en la adquisición de un carrito salchipapero; con el primer préstamo que obtuvo compró mercadería para su negocio, y con los ingresos que obtuvo pudo terminar de pagar esta inversión, así mismo le permitió seguir educando a sus dos menores hijos en el colegio. 
Miriam piensa seguir invirtiendo con el reciente préstamo que obtuvo en el negocio de las salchipapas, hamburguesas, pollo broaster. Lo que piensa hacer más adelante es comprar una res con el capital que recibirá, lo que a futuro tendrá mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Bosco - A small community bank made up of ten people, all of whom work in the retail industry. The members have worked with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD for three and a half years. The have invested the loans that they have received during this time in their own businesses with different objectives. Mirian Blanca C. A., who is group president, has a small farm in the town of Vicas (Huarochiri), land that was given to her by her mother. She cultivates crops according to the season, such as: alfalfa, corn, broad beans, potatoes and peas. With this business she has looked after her family and sent her children to college; she has faced this responsibility alone since ending her relationship with her husband.

During this time she worked to save some money that she invested in the acquisition of a salchipapas (fast food usually made of sausage and French fries) cart. With her first loan she bought some merchandise for her business, and with the income she earned, she was able to finish her repayments, which in turn meant that she could continue educating her two youngest children at college.

Miriam intends to continue investing the loan that she recently obtained in her salchipapas, hamburger and roast chicken business. In the future she intends to buy a cow with the capital she will receive, which will mean greater income for her family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Las Semillitas Group

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira Núñez, natural D. Chosica Lima – Perú, tiene 40 años D. edad conviviente, con  4 hijos. 
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 2 años, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D.  la alcancía comunal “Las Semillitas”, el cual  esta conformado por  11 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: venta y alquiler D. vestidos y ropas, venta D. comida y otros.
Inicialmente se dedicaba a la preparación y venta D. tamales, tortas  y lonches, según pedidos, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles.
Actualmente tiene su restaurante “EL PIQUEOS” desD. hace un año, con el  préstamo D. S/.1200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara los insumos necesarios para abastecer tanto para la comida, postres y tamales, mediante los cuales le ayuda incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar la calidad D. vida educativa D. sus hijos.
En el futuro anhela formar una pequeña empresa D. tamales y que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edelmira, from Chosica, Lima, Peru, is 40 years old and lives with her partner and 4 children. She has already been working with EDAPROSPO for 2 years and now assumes the position of president of the small community bank “Las Semillitas”, which is maD. up of 11 members who have various businesses such as: selling and hiring out clothing, selling food, and other things. Originally she maD. and sold tamales (steamed corn-dough wrapped in banana leaves), tortas and snacks, maD. to order. Her initial loan was for 500 Peruvian soles. Now she has had a restaurant “El Piqueos” for a year. With the loan of 1,200 soles she will buy the necessary supplies to prepare the food, deserts and tamales, which help her to increase her income and improve her children’s quality of life and education. In the future she would like to start a small tamales business and for her children to have good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the necessary supplies to prepare food, deserts and tamales

loans.name: Los Colavoradores, Group 5

texts.en:
Rosalene M. (far right) is the coordinator of a solidarity group within Los Colavoradores, an Esperanza Bank of Hope. She and her group members are from Juan Dolio, a town in the Dominican Republic. She is a Haitian immigrant, a class of people that frequently faces harsh discrimination in the DR. 

Rosalene makes her living selling clothes, something she has done for four years. To maintain her stock, she travels to Santo Domingo up to three times a week! She has taken out this loan, her third with Esperanza, so that she can afford to buy more clothes in a single trip to the capital. This would allow her to decrease the frequency with which she must travel to buy clothes, saving her a lot of money on transportation costs. 

Rosalene has six children, ranging in age from 12 to 20. Even at these ages, all of them attend some sort of school. Two of them so far have expressed career aspirations, she says, one wanting to be a doctor, and another a mechanic.

Please lend to Rosalene and her group to help them achieve their goals!

loans.use: Larger clothing stocks

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.en:
Euphrasie M. is a married mother of two children, aged six and four, who are both in school. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the largest city and economic capital of Bénin. Her husband is a chauffeur and cook for a family.

In Cotonou, Euphrasie sells a variety of goods, including corn, rice, beans, cooking oil, gasoline, and charcoal. She has been in business for five years. At first, she sold only corn and flour, but was able to expand her selection after she took out her first loan from Alidé in 2007. Euphrasie is seeking another loan from Alidé so that she can purchase more goods to sell. She is currently saving money so that one day she can purchase her own home. She also hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase corn, rice, beans, cooking oil, petroleum and charcoal

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La señora Benita y su esposo, Enrique, viven en la  zona Valle de las Flores junto a sus dos pequeños hijos. Ella se dedica al Tejido artesanal con lana e hilo de mantas y ropa de niños. Comenzó con esta actividad hace tres años. Don Enrique es albañil y con esta catividad le ayuda a su esposa en los gastos de la casa. Solicitan el crédito para aumentar un cuarto en la casa y utilizarlo como taller para los tejidos. Ellos son muy responsables con su familia y su trabajo.
texts.en:
Benita and her husband Enrique live in the Valle de las Flores zone together with their two small children. She makes artisan cloth from wool and thread into blankets and childrens clothes. She started this business three years ago. Enrique is a bricklayer and through his work he helps his wife with the household expenses. They are asking for a loan to add a room to the house and use it as a cloth-making workshop. They are a very responsible and hardworking family.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and clay for construction work

loans.name: Los Colavoradores, Group 7

texts.en:
Nadine Reculé (far right) is the coordinator of a solidarity group within Los Colavoradores, an Esperanza Bank of Hope from Juan Dolio, a town near San Pedro de Macorís in the Dominican Republic. Nadine is an immigrant from Haiti, where she was trained as a nurse. Unfortunately, she has been unable to get a job as a nurse here in the Dominican Republic, so she has had to find other ways to make a living. Two years ago she opened her own colmadito, a small convenience store she runs out of her home. She currently sells snack items such as soda, candy, and chips. Unsatisfied with the current state of her business, Nadine has applied for her first-ever microloan! With the loan money, she plans to invest in food supplies such as rice, beans, and cooking oils. 

Nadine has two daughters, ages six and four, who are both in school. She says that she wants nothing more than for them to grow up to be nurses. 

Please lend to Nadine and her group as they strive to achieve their goals!

loans.use: Rice, beans, cooking oils

loans.name: Dianora Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora Dianora H. ha unido sus esfuerzos para lograr mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia la cual requiere de la inversión en su vivienda de habitación la cual ha sufrido mucho a raíz y que los años han transcurrido y debe ser reconstruida.

Es por este motivo que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta forma salir brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of León, Ms. Dianora H. has united her efforts to be able to improve her family's living conditions. This requires an investment in her home, which has suffered much at its foundation as the years have passed by and therefore must be rebuilt. It is for this reason that she has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase the construction materials and in this way to provide a better quality of life to her family who need her support so much.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Redey Daniel

texts.es:
"El Sr. Redey, tiene la actividad económica de servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi, su hermano que es el conductor, actualmente el cliente presta servicios como conductor personal de la Cónsul de Dinamarca en el país.
El cliente cuenta con una familia estable que esta compuesta por sus tres hijos y su esposa quien trabaja como empleada domestica con una familia de la zona."
texts.en:
The business of Mr. Redey is the urban transport of passengers in a radio-taxi. His brother is the taxi driver. The customer is now the chauffeur of the consul of Denmark in the country. The customer has a stable family that consists of his three children and his wife. His wife works as a maid for a family in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of tires and repair of his vehicle.

loans.name: Ivania María

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora Ivania N. T. se está esforzando grandemente para llevar a cabo su obra de construcción de su vivienda por la razón de que debe brindarle las condiciones necesarias a sus dos hijos para que puedan tener un techo digno donde habitar ya que su vivienda ha tenido muchas dificultades.

El crédito que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de materiales de construcción para levantar paredes, construir cuartos, entre otras actividades que le serán de beneficio en su vivienda de habitación.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of León, Mrs. Ivania N. T. is making a great effort to carry out the construction of her house. It will offer her two children the necessary conditions so that they can have a dignified house to live in, since she has had many difficulties with her house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials to put up walls and build rooms, among other projects that will improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: Las Cuatro señoras y su hija de doña Catarina que se muestra en la foto, es el grupo Nuevo Horizonte, que a venido a pedir un apoyo para ellas, ya que quieren ampliar sus capitales  para tener mojor ingresos y tener mojor condiciones de vida; ellas elaboran y fabrican ropa tipica y compra y venta de la misma, para poder sobre salir de esas condiciones que se encuentra  y las tres alquilan y una no, y quieren aumentar sus capital y asi obtener màs imgresos para poder posteriormente construir una pequeña vivienda, para hacer de su realidad de sus sueños, ellas acuden a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para concretizar este sueño; ya que otras entidades no les apoyan por estar en el area de Pobleza.
texts.en:
The four women and Mrs. Catarina’s daughter, who are shown in the photo, are members of New Horizon (Nuevo Horizonte) Group. They are asking for support, since they want to increase their capital so that they can have higher incomes and improve the quality of their lives. They make, buy and sell typical clothing, so that they can survive in the conditions in which they find themselves. Three of them rent a home and one does not. They want to increase their capital and, in this way, have a larger income so that they can later build a small home to make their dreams comes true. They came to Asociación ASDIR to realize their dream, since other entities didn’t support them because they are from a poor area.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their businesses

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
El señor Marlon C. es un agricultor del municipio de Telica el cual se dedica a la siembra de ajonjolí, maíz y sorgo desde hace varios años teniendo experiencia amplia en esta actividad que requiere de muchísimo esfuerzo para llevarla a cabo.

Hoy en día, el señor Marlon atraviesa una necesidad y es la de invertir en la compra de los fertilizantes para llevar a cabo su actividad ya que la siembra de ajonjolí, maíz y sorgo requiere de estos fertilizantes a lo inmediato. Muy confiadamente espera ser beneficiado con un crédito para dar lugar a su actividad y así alcanzar una cosecha muy buena.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlon C. is a farmer from the municipality of Telica. He has grown sesame, corn, and sorghum for many years, and he has a lot of experience in this activity, which requires a lot of effort to carry out. Today, Mr. Marlon needs to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to pursue his activity, since his sesame, corn and sorghum crops need these fertilizers immediately. He is hopeful that he will benefit from a loan to support his activity and, in this way, to achieve a very good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Marie Vianney H., a 21-year-old single man. He and his 16-year-old sister are orphans so he takes care of his sister with whom he lives in the Mukamira sector of the northern province.

This entrepreneur operates his business in Mukamira, where he sews clothes and sells them. He started this business three years ago and works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mr H. used to obtain a monthly profit of approximately $200 after paying his three workers who help him to run his business smoothly. Now he is seeking his first loan worth 300,000 RWF from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan he will buy more fabric to make more clothes. In this way he plans to expand his business and make more profit. As a result he will buy two more modern sewing machines for making more quality products.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: William Genaro

texts.es:
Desde hace 15 años, en el municipio de Telica y en su propia casa de habitación el señor William C. se dedica a su actividad pecuaria por medio de la crianza de cerdos los cuales son alimentados por él mismo y criados con el propósito de sacarles el máximo provecho.

La crianza la realiza en su localidad y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere de la inversión en la actividad por medio de la compra de un cerdo para la crianza. Es por este motivo que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para proceder a la compra del cerdo y así continuar en el mejoramiento de vida en conjunto con su familia.
texts.en:
For 15 years William C. has been raising livestock at his house, which is in the Telica municipality. He raises pigs. He feeds them and takes care of them in order to get the best price for them. He raises them in his town. He now comes to Ceprodel because he needs a loan to buy a pig to raise. That is why he hopes that Ceprodel will give him the loan to buy the pig. That way he can continue improving his life and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pig

loans.name: Mireisis Rmona

texts.es:
Desde hace cuatro años, en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora Mireisis R. se dedica a su actividad económica de venta de cerámicas ofrecidas en su casa de habitación donde a diario oferta sus productos.

Actualmente requiere surtir su negocio para abastecer a sus clientes y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno para la compra de las cerámicas y así ofertarlas en su municipio a todos los clientes que ella posee.
texts.en:
Mireisis R. has been selling ceramics for four years in the Telica municipality of the city of León. She sells every day from her house. She currently needs to stock her business in order to supply her customers. That is why she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. She will buy ceramics to sell to all of her customers in her municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ceramics

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: Don Bernardino es un cliente antiguo de la institución, puntual y muy responsable, tiene su movilidad con la que trabaja como radio taxi, vive con su esposa en su casita propia, sus hijos ya son independientes pero como todo papá se preocupa siempre por ellos y por su bienestar. Invertirá el crédito en el mantenimiento general de la movilidad, para que pueda trabajar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Don Bernardino is a punctual, very responsible, long-time customer of the institution. The vehicle with which he works is a radio-taxi. He lives with his wife in their own small house. His children are already independent, but, as all fathers, he is always concerned about them and their well-being. He will invest the loan in the general maintenance of his vehicle, so that he can work without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: WILL BE INVESTED IN THE MAINTENANCE OF HIS VEHICLE

loans.name: Beatrice
