Casilda is 29. She lives with her 38 year old husband, Eugenio, and their children; 14 year old Jocelyn, 11 year old Angélica, and 5 year old Diana. With the desire to provide her family with a better quality of life, she saw how convenient it would be to work in the business her husband started. He solders in a fishing factory, and he had the idea of making ovens. Casilda manages all of the income and expenses, and she buys all of the materials needed for the workers to make ovens. She wishes for her family to progress, and this business is a good source of income. Also, she feels independent and useful to society. In the near future she would like to expand her factory, buy more tools, and contract more people to also generate a source of employment. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She expects to work very well with the institution. She promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. The loan is to buy a machine that will help with making the ovens. Casilda feels that this purchase is the first step in improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy machinery for her business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive con su hijo Junior de 12 años, quien es el motor que impulsa su vida. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder mantenerse, el comercio ha significado para ella su principal fuente de manutención, y cuando llegó su pequeño hijo, hace 12 años, tuvo que optar por una labor que le permitiera estar más tiempo en su casa para cuidarlo y ayudarlo con sus tareas y educación. Es por eso que empezó a vender ropa a domicilio, labor que consiste en visitar las casas de sus amistades y vecinos para ofrecer las diferentes prendas que compra en uno de los centros comerciales más conocidos de Lima, esto en el centro de la ciudad. Susana vende a precios cómodos, es por ello que obtiene gran cantidad de clientela, además las prendas son de buena calidad, siendo un negocio muy rentable para ella. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprar 2 motocarros, los cuales alquila al día, obteniendo un ingreso extra por ello. Para un futuro cercano, a Susana le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa en su domicilio para no tener que caminar tanto. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y está muy feliz con su grupo solidario, ya que ha quedado  las socias más puntuales, y todas son buenas amigas. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de más prendas, para así incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Susana, 32, is a very happy woman. She lives with her 12 year old son, Junior. He is the motor that drives her life. Since she was very young she has worked to be able to support herself. Commerce has been her primary source of support. When her small son arrived 12 years ago, she had to choose work that would allow her to spend more time at home taking care of him and helping him with his homework and education. That is why she started to sell clothes at home. She visits the homes of her friends and neighbors to offer different articles of clothing that she buys in one of the most well known commercial centers in Lima, which is in the center of the city. Susana sells at low prices, and that is why she has a lot of customers. Through her work efforts she has been able to buy two “motocarros” (three wheeled motorized cart). She rents them out by the day, which gives her extra income. In the near future, Susana would like to have a clothing store in her house so that she would not have to walk so much. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is very happy with her supportive group. The members are very punctual, and they are all good friends. The money will be used to buy more clothes in order to increase her sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Elza

texts.es: Elza tiene 53 años, como madre, sola tuvo que educar a sus 5 hijos, a quienes trató de ofrecer las mejores condiciones de vida. Desde joven trabajó en múltiples actividades, ahora se dedica a la venta de dulces en la puerta de su casa. Sus hijos ya son mayores, entonces ahora sólo requiere lo necesario para sus necesidades personales. Esta actividad le viene respondiendo de manera favorable, ya que su domicilio está ubicado en una de las avenidas más transitadas de su comunidad. Aprovechando esta concurrencia, Elza desea instalar un puesto de comida en la esquina de su casa, donde las personas ya están acostumbradas a visitar, para ello trabajaría durante todo el día, ya que la venta de dulces sólo la realiza por las tardes, cuando los escolares salen de sus centros de estudios; pero con el puesto de comida tendría la posibilidad de incrementar sus ganancias diarias. Es así que sus deseos de progresar la motivan a seguir trabajando como hasta el día de hoy. Lleva 5 años trabajando con MFP, donde ya tiene 9 préstamos y lo que más le gusta es el entusiasmo y compromiso que hay en cada una de sus compañeras por salir adelante y ver el progreso de su banco comunal. Los 1500 soles que solicita le permitirán adquirir los productos e ingredientes necesarios para seguir trabajando en su negocio y para la pronta posibilidad de tener su puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Elza is 53 years old. As a mother, she had to educate her 5 children and tried to offer them the best living conditions. From an early age, she has worked in numerous jobs and currently sells candy from the front door of her house. Now that her children are adults, she only requires what is necessary to meet her personal living expenses. Her business is doing quite favorably since her home is located on one of the most traveled roads in the community. Using this to her advantage, Elza has set up a food stand at the corner of her house where people are accustomed to passing by every day. She only sells candy in the afternoons when students are leaving school. Since selling food would increase her daily earnings, she is motivated to continue working throughout the entire day.

Elza has been working with MFP for 5 years and has already taken out 9 loans. She likes the enthusiasm and commitment of her fellow group members to get ahead and enjoys watching the progress of her communal bank. Her loan of 1500 soles will be used to acquire products and necessary ingredients to keep her business going and start her food stand as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a new food business

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en: Gleen M. is from the village of Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Gleen owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily financing and harvesting mangoes for sale. Gleen has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 12,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Gleen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Ma. Rona

texts.en:
MA. RONA A. is 41 years old, married with 6 school-age children and a resident of Brgy. Purisima, Manapla, Negros Occidental.

Since Rona joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has gone into two business ventures that takes advantage of her innate talents and both have fortunately been able to provide for the needs of her family. In one business, she sells Ready-to-Wear Clothes and in her other business, she sells frozen food products.

Rona is borrowing PHP 10,000.00 for this 19th loan cycle so that she could increase her inventory and have more working capital in her businesses. She just paid off a PHP 15,000 loan from her previous loan cycle, but she needs a smaller loan now which she plans to pay off in a shorter period.

As a working mom, Ma. Rona Azuela balances her time between her business and family to ensure that her children are well cared for while working hard to provide for their immediate needs and saving up for their future security.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL INVENTORY & WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
GINA M. is 45 years old, married with 7 school-age children, and a resident of Punta Cabahug, Brgy. Zone 5, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.

With 7 school-age children, Gina and her husband realize that they need to have several sources of income to provide for their family. This is why in addition to her main business of salted dried fish production, she raises hogs on the side.

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 and the loans she borrowed have been a big help in providing her with working capital so that she could increase her income capacity. The new loan she is taking is already her  18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. The PHP 30,000.00 she is borrowing will be used to purchase fish and other ingredients she needs in her salted dried fish production.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: INGREDIENTS FOR THE BORROWER'S FOOD PRODUCTION

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn R., a 26-year-old single woman from the village of Batibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Charlyn is just starting this business.

Charlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC, Charlyn is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
IMELDA P. is 52 years old, married with 8 school-age to adult children and a resident of Brgy. Jerusalem, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.

Imelda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 and for the past 6 years enganged in selling dried fish and rice in her local community. This earns her approximately PHP 20,000 per month and is a big factor in the financial security of her relatively large family.

With some of the children still going to school, Imelda is determined to increase her income potential so that she could set aside some money for the education of her children while providing for their immediate needs. 

For this 11th loan cycle, Imelda is borrowing PHP 17,000.00 to increase the volume of her inventory and have more items to sell to her customers. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL INVENTORY AND WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
ANNABELLE V. is a resident of Brgy. Tortosa, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She is married with 3 school-age children.

In 1998, Annabelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could start a business that will help support her family. She invested in a fishing business, and she also sells the catch to the local community.  Over the years, Annabelle was able to have her own pump boat which has increased her income potential. At present, her fishing boat and revenue from selling the catch in the local market nets an average of PHP 14,000 per month.

Now for her 18th loan cycle, Annabelle is borrowing PHP 10,000.00 as additional working capital so that she can continue expanding the operations of her business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
LILIBETH M. has 4 adult children,is separated from her husband and lives in Brgy. Chambery, Manapla, Negros Occidental. 

As a single parent, she has been earning a living for the past 12 years by operating a General Store with a twist - she also offers Over-the-Counter Medicines and other health products to her neighbors. Since she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999, Lilibeth has continously invested her loans into her business and added more variety to her product offerings, and it nets PHP 5,000.00 per month.

For her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 19,500.00 to purchase more goods to sell in her General store and to add to her working capital.

Lilibeth is working industriously not only to support her family but also to save for her future economic security.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL WORKING CAPITAL & INVENTORY

loans.name: Mary Josephine

texts.en:
MARY JOSEPHINE R. of Punta Cabahug, Brgy. Zone 5, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental is 49 years old, and married with 5 adult children. She has been earning a living making and selling dried fish for the last 10 years, which earns about PHP 7,000.00 per month.

Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 to gain access to much needed capital for her business. She has since then used all of her loans to gradually expand her production capacity so that she could earn more money tp support her family.

Josephine is now on her 20th loan cycle and she wants to again use the PHP 12,000.00 she is borrowing to enable her to buy more fish to dry and sell. She continues to work hard so that she could obtain financial security for herself and her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: INGREDIENTS FOR DRIED FISH PRODUCTION

loans.name: Lilebeth

texts.en:
LILEBETH D. of Brgy. Tortosa, Manapla, Negros Occidental, is a married 51 year-old woman wtih 7 adult children. She and her family earn their living from fishing and selling seafood products in the local community for the past 27 years.

In 1998, Lilebeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could improve her earning capacity with the unsecured loans she borrowed to add to her working capital, and it has helped a lot in making their lives a little more comfortable than before, earning PHP 5,600.00 monthly for her family.

For her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lilebeth is borrowing PHP 7,000.00 to add to her working capital to roll over so that she could increase her earning capacity.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL CAPITAL FOR HER FISH SELLING BUSINESS

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
LYNIE D. of Brgy. Tortosa, Manapla, Negros Occidental is single at 28 but she has plans for her life.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in June 2005 so that she could help her support her parents and  gain financial independence for herself. A year ago, she decided to put up a general store and it has proved to be a good business decision for it now earns her an average of PHP 25,000.00 per month.

Now she needs PHP 13,000.00 to add to her working capital in the General Store. This is already her 18th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon and it has been a big help in providing her with the much needed capital infusion so she could stock her store with the goods that are in demand within her neighborhood.

Lynie believes that gaining financial independence and security is important for the woman of today.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL CAPITAL FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: La señora Gloria vive sola con sus tres hijos, esta separada de su esposo y por tal motivo se esfuerza por salir adelante; ella labora en una residencia realizando labores domesticas como ingreso extra, ya que tiene su tiendita de abarrotes establecida desde hace un año. Esta solicitando este crédito para invertir en su negocio porque es el patrimonio familiar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria lives with her three children. She is separated from her husband and therefore strives to get ahead. Sra. Gloria works at a boarding house doing household chores for extra income. She also runs a small grocery store that she started a year ago.

She is requesting a loan to invest into her business because it is the only asset she has available to leave to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rosa Martha

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Martha vive en su casa cuenta on la compañía de su hijo y la familia de el, ya que ella es viuda y son una familia muy unida. Su hijo Mario Arturo labora en Comisión Federal de la Electricidad y contribuye para el apoyo a los gastos familiares.
La señora Rosa Martha se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo tales como el Tupper Ware (refractarios), Jafra ( cosméticos ) y uno ultimo de medicina natural, teniendo ya su clientela desde hace 12 años, proyecto por el cual esta solicitando este crédito e invertir en mas mercancía para tenerla en bodega y así cuando sus clientes deseen algún producto tenerlo al instante.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Martha lives at home in the company of her son and his family. She is a widow and her family is very close. Her son Mario Arturo works for the Federal Electricity Commission and contributes toward the family expenses.

Sra. Rosa Martha sells products through catalogs such as TupperWare (heat resistant kitchenware), Jafra (cosmetics), and the latest natural medicines. She has maintained her customer base for 12 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more merchandise she can keep in storage and have available so that her customers can receive them instantly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory for her business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El enfermero Francisco Javier vive con su mama, ya que el todavía es soltero;
El labora para u hospital en nuestra ciudad desde hace 2 años en el área de enfermería, y también con comisiones extras como instrumentistas de apoyo en cirugías, el tiene un proyecto establecido desde hace un año que es la venta de ropa nueva de marca americana y ropa que trae de la ciudad de Monterrey Nuevo León, motivo por el cual esta solicitando el crédito para realizar la inversión en mas mercancía para su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier is a nurse and lives with his mother because he is still single.

He works at a hospital in the city and has been a nurse for 2 years. Francisco also works additional shifts as a support technician during surgeries. He started a side business a year ago selling new American brands of clothing that he acquires from the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. He is requesting a loan to obtain more merchandise for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in more merchandise for his business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena vive con sus 2 hijas de edad escolar, ya que es divorciada, ella se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas desde hace 2 años surte como proveedor a una tienda.
Su proyecto es para invertir en la compra de mas material para la fabricación de mas piñatas, y así su venta se incrementara, por tal motivo esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. María Magdalena is divorced and lives with her 2 school-aged daughters. She has been making piñatas for 2 years and supplies them to a retail store. Her requested loan will be used to purchase materials needed to make more piñatas and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making piñatas

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús R. de 60 años de edad reside en Lourdes Colon del departamento de La Libertad. Jesús se dedica a la panadería, negocio propio que inicio hace doce años con el apoyo de su esposa, la panadería de Jesús posee una buena clientela y ha ido ganado la preferencia de muchos a través de los años y también por la fama que tiene el pan de Jose, el crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad es para destino en capital de trabajo ya que desea comprar materia prima para la elaboración de pan.
texts.en:
Jesús R. is 60 years old and lives in Lourdes Colon in La Libertad District. He operates a bakery, a business he started 12 years ago with the help of his wife. His bakery has a good customer base and has become a favorite of many over the years. Jesús is famous for his bread.

The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to buy ingredients for making bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia G. M. vive en el departamento de la  Libertad en la zona occidental del país , a sus 51 años de edad, cuenta con el orgullo de haber criado su hijo de ahora 20 años de edad, quien gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo de Virginia y su esposo, tiene la posibilidad de estudiar. Virginia maneja una pequeña venta de pupusas y tortillas, con la cual mantiene su casa y su familia. Virginia solicita un préstamo que le sirva como el pilar , y meta para hacer crecer su modesto negocio con la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima para expandir así su negocio
texts.en:
Virginia G. M. lives in the La Libertad department in the western area of the country. She is 51, and she has the pride of having raised her 20 year old son. Thanks to Virginia’s and her husband’s work and effort, he has the option of an education. Virginia runs a small business selling “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) and tortillas. This is how she supports her house and her family. Virginia is asking for a loan that will act as a pillar for her goal to expand her modest business. She will buy a larger quantity of raw materials to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Rhina Elizabeth

texts.es: Rhina Elizabeth G. G. vive en el departamento de La Libertad. Desde hace ya catorce años, Rhina se dedica a la venta de ropa, mediante una venta que monto en su propia casa. Rhina no lo hace sola, su esposo y tres hijos le ayudan y colaboran en la venta, a pesar que sus dos hijos menores, tiene tan solo 8 y 6 años. Rhina Elizabeth solicita un préstamo, para comprar nueva mercadería y diversificar la gama de productos que comercializa, pues considera de mucha importancia conservar  el espíritu de superación que tanto le ha ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rhina Elizabeth G. G. lives in the La Libertad department. Rhina has been selling clothes since she was 14 years old. She sells from a location she set up in her home. Rhina does not do this alone. Her husband and three children help her and work with her. They do this in spite of the fact that her two youngest children are only eight and six years old. Rhina Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise and diversify the range of products that she sells. She feels it is very important to keep the spirit of improving herself that has helped her so much to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor H. D. R. vive en el departamento costero D. La Libertad. Tras no contar con educación superior y ninguna capacitación laboral, Leonor ha aprendido poco a poco a manejar una venta D. ropa, que se ha convertido en una indispensable fuente D. ingresos para mantener a sus dos hijos menores D. edad, Emilia e Isaías. Al aproximarse ambos hijos a la adolescencia, Leonor trabaja diariamente con la ilusión D. poder costearles una educación formal , que les permita a ellos tener las oportunidades y preparación que ella no tuvo, es por esto que Leonor solicita un préstamo para adquirir nuevos productos  para vender y continuar luchando por darle a su descendencia, un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Leonor H. D. R. lives in the coastal department of La Libertad. Even though she has no high school education and no work training, Leonor has learned, little by little, to manage her business of selling clothes. She has maD. it an indispensable source of income to support her two minor children, Emilia and Isaías. As both children approach adolescence, Leonor works every day with the hope of being able to pay for their formal education, which would allow them to have opportunities and preparation that she did not have. That is why Leonor is asking for a loan to get new products to sell. She will continue to fight to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es: Arnoldo C. vive en Santiago Texacuango municipio en la capital del país, San Salvador.  Debido a dificultades económicas, Arnoldo vive con su esposa y familia, en la casa de sus padres. La vida de Arnoldo no ha sido fácil, pues no contó con la oportunidad de educarse formalmente, hecho que le deja un futuro con oportunidades recortadas. A pesar de esto. Arnoldo es optimista y trabajador, desde hace ya 11 años, maneja un puesto de venta de cereales en el mercado de Santiago Texacuango, y con arduo trabajo y dedicación ha logrado crecer de paso en paso. Arnoldo solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y comprar nueva mercadería, que le permita vender más, y cumplir su sueño de independizarse y brindarle a su esposa y familia, un hogar propio.
texts.en:
Arnoldo C. lives in the Santiago Texacuango municipality in the country’s capital, San Salvador. Due to economic difficulties, Arnoldo lives with his wife and family in his parents’ house. Arnoldo’s life has not been easy. He did not have the chance to have a formal education. This fact left him with reduced opportunities for the future. In spite of this, Arnoldo is optimistic and hard working. For 11 years he has managed a stall where he sells grains in the Santiago Texacuango market. Through arduous work and dedication he has been able to grow step by step. Arnoldo is asking for a loan to reinvest in his business and buy new merchandise. That will allow him to sell more. Then his dream of becoming independent and giving his wife and family their own home will come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his business

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel V. D. M. vive en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Hace apenas dos años monto por si sola una tienda personal en su propia casa. Sus dos hijos y su esposo le ayudan en la tienda y a la vez trabajan cada uno por aparte para aportar al mantenimiento D. la casa. A pesar D. haber vivido momentos muy difíciles, Reina y su esposo han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, dándoles los estudios adecuados que aseguren su formación. Reina y su familia solicitan un préstamo para refinanciar su negocio y hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel V. D. M. lives in the Sonsonate district. It has been almost two years since she opened a store in her own home. Her two children and her husband help with the store and at times they work apart so that one of them can tend to the house. Despite having lived through difficult situations, Reina and her husband have managed to push their children ahead by giving them an adequate education required for their personal growth.

Reina and her family are requesting a loan to fund their business so that it can expand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to grow her business

loans.name: María Blanca Rosa

texts.es: María Blanca Rosa C. D. G.  vive en Sensuntepeque, municipio en el  departamento D. Cabañas. Debido a dificultades económicas, su esposo se ha visto obligado a llevar dos trabajos, uno D. agricultor y otro D. albañil. Blanca, además D. criar a sus dos hijos D. tan solo 5 y 7 años,  le ayuda manejando una humilD. venta ambulante D. productos por catalogo. El trabajo ambulante es muy pesado para María, que sale a las calles diariamente desD. las 7am a vender sus productos, cuya demanda ha empezado a crecer. María y su familia solicitan un préstamo para ampliar su mercadería y poder así ofrecer mayor cantidad D. productos, que la generen nuevos ingresos y un presente más estable.
texts.en:
María Blanca Rosa C. D. G. lives in Sensuntepeque, a municipality in the Cabanas department. Because of economic difficulties, her husband has found himself having to work two jobs, one as a farmer and one as a bricklayer. Maria, in addition to raising their two children, who are only five and seven years old, helps him by running a small traveling business that sells products out of a catalog. The mobile business is hard for Maria, who gets out onto the streets everyday at 7 am to sell her products, demand for which has started to grow. Maria and her family are asking for a loan to help increase their merchandise so they will be able to offer a larger quantity of products, which will bring in new income and more stability.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Dolores De Jesús

texts.es: Dolores de Jesús A. H. tiene 30 años de edad, y vive con su esposo y tres hijos, todos menores de edad. La mayoría de su tiempo lo pasa, manejando su negocio de comedor y restaurante que abrió hace 3 años. El comedor se ha coinvertido en su única fuente de ingresos estable. Dolores difícilmente ve a sus hijos, pues el comedor le demanda su total atención y esfuerzo diario. Dolores solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva materia prima para su comedor, y vender así nuevos productos que ayuden a  convertir  a su humilde restaurante, en un negocio más rentable y sostenible, y poder así  apartar más tiempo del día, para pasarlo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores de Jess Aguilon Hernandez is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and has 3 children, all of whom are still minors. She spends most of her time managing her food store/restaurant, which was opened 3 years ago. The store has become her only form of stable income. With difficulty, Dolores looks after her children but the store requires her full attention and daily effort. Dolores is seeking a loan to purchase raw materials for her store and to buy new products that will allow her humble store to become more profitable and sustainable. This way she might be able to spend more time during the day with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials and Store Supplies

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Préstamo Anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102241&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Sonia es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino, ha incursionado en otros negocios, se ha puesto a vender comida por las noches en su casa, también vende cerveza y gaseosa.
Sonia necesita  un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de una vitrina, quiere poner en su casa su bazar.
Los préstamos le están ayudando a crecer en el negocio, cuenta con mas capital.   
El sueño de Sonia es  tener un puesto propio de bazar.
texts.en:
Prior loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102241&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Sonia is a member of the communal bank Nino Divino. She has worked in various businesses and has been able to to sell food, beer, and soft drinks from her house at night. Sonia needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy a window, which she would like to put in her house. These loans have helped her build her business, and she relies on this continued source of capital. Sonia's dream is to have her own shop one day.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a Window

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa  es socia del Bancomunal  Niño Divino 
Jesusa es conviviente tiene 37 años, tres hijos de 19, 12 y 8 años, los dos últimos están  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Jesusa se  dedicaba a su casa y a cuidar a sus hijos, pero vio la necesidad de apoyar en la economía de su casa, y con un préstamo que se hizo puso en su casa una bodega  ella atiende y sus hijos le ayudan.
Desde que Jesusa esta en Finca  los prestamos son un apoyo, aprendió a ser solidaria con sus compañeras.
Jesusa necesita un préstamo de 800 soles,  para la compra de cerveza, gaseosa, golosinas y arroz.
El sueño de Jesusa es que su negocio crezca mas, por que quiere techar su casa.
texts.en:
Jesusa is a member of the communal bank Nino Divino. She is 37 years old, married and has three children who are aged 19, 12, and 8 years old respectively. Her two youngest children are currently enrolled in public school. Jesusa takes care of the house and her children, but also needs to support the household financially. With a prior loan she was able to set up a convenient store from her house, which she looks after with the help of her children. Ever since Jesusa joined Finca these loans have been a major support for her, and with the help of her female group members she has learned to be more independent. Jesusa needs a loan of 800 soles to buy beer, soft drinks, candies and rice. Jesusa's dream is that her store continues to grow so that she can roof her house.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Store Supplies

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia  es socia del Bancomunal  Niño Divino, es casada, tiene 39 años y tiene tres hijos de 14, 10 y 4 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Zonia  estudio cosmetología, trabajo en un salón de belleza, consiguió otro trabajo donde le pagaban mas,  trabajó como cajera en un supermercado como cajera, pero  se caso y salio embarazada, con el tiempo se puso a vender productos de belleza por catalogo, y también esta vendiendo gas en su casa.  
Desde que zonia esta en Finca, aprendió a  ahorra, a programar  en su negocio, a ser cumplida con los pagos. 
Zonia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles,  para la compra de ropa y productos de belleza por catalogo.
El sueño de Zonia es tener una peluquería.
texts.en:
Zonia is a member of the Divine Child Communal Bank. She is married, 39 years old, and has three children who are 14, 10, and four years old, who go to public school. Zonia studied cosmetology, worked in a beauty salon, found another job that paid more, worked as a cashier in a supermarket but married and became pregnant, and with [the resulting free] time started to sell beauty products out of a catalog. She also sells gas out of her home. Since Zonia has been with Kiva partner Finca, she has learned to save money, do business planning, and make her payments on time. She needs a loan of 1,200 soles in order to purchase clothes and beauty products from the catalog. Zonia's dream is to have a hairdresser's shop.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes and beauty products

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Préstamo Anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102243&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Liliana  es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino, continúa vendiendo tamales, su ventas han crecido, ha contratado mas personal para que le ayuden.
Liliana  necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de mercadería para hacer tamales, maíz  hoja de plátano, gallina, chancho.
El préstamo esta ayudando, ella esta aprendiendo  como crecer en su negocio  
El sueño de Liliana sigue siendo el mismo crecer más y contratar personal para que trabajen para su negocio, y ellos se dediquen a administrar.
texts.en:
Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102243&... Liliana is a member of the Niño Divino Community Bank. She is still selling tamales. Her sales have increased, and she has hired mO. people to help her. Liliana needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy merchandise to make her tamales. She will buy corn, banana leaves, chicken, and pork. The loan is helping. She is learning how to grow in her business. Liliana’s dream is to keep being the same, to grow mO., and to hire people to work in the business so that she can devote her time to running it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to make tamales

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Préstamo Anterior: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102244&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
Rosario es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino, se dedica a la venta de ropa y  calzado  de segunda y nuevo al crédito. También  con su hijo han puesto un  negocio de vidriería  en su casa.
Rosario necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de ropa zapatos e invertir en vidrios.
Los préstamos han ayudado a surgir en su negocio, ella solo saca lo que puede pagar. 
El sueño de Rosario es tener un puesto de ferretería.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the Village Bank "Niño Divino." She sells used and new clothing and footwear on credit. Additionally, with her son she has a glass workshop in her house. Rosario needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy clothes, shoes, and invest in more glass. The loans have helped her to develop her business and she never borrows more than she can afford. Rosario's dream is to have her own hardware store. Her earlier loan can be found at: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102244&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing and shoes and investing in glass

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Préstamo Anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102246&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Cristina  es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino, Cristina sigue vendiendo ropa usada, también se esta dedicando por las mañanas a cocinar en una casa, ha logrado comprase un carro de segunda que lo da para a hace servicio de taxi.   
Cristina necesita un préstamo, de 1600 soles, para la compra de mercadería de ropa y zapatos.  
Desde que esta en Finca, ha sido de mucho apoyo, puede ahorrar  y realizar ahorros voluntarios, las charlas que reciben han sido de ayuda para su negocio.
El sueño de cristina es comprarse un terreno y construir una tienda  para su negocio.
texts.en:
Previous loan found here: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102246&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 . Cristina is a member of the Niño Divino Communal Bank. She continues selling used clothes, and is also spending her mornings cooking in a home. She's been able to buy herself a pre-owned car that she uses as a taxi service. Cristina needs a 1,600 soles loan (Peruvian currency) for the purchase of merchandise: clothing and shoes. Since she's been with Finca, it has been greatly helpful; she has been able to save, and the talks that the receive have aided her in her business. Cristina's dream is to buy herself land where she can construct a store for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and clothing

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Préstamo Anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102248&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Tania  socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino, Tania se sigue dedicando a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, ella ahora vende de todo lo que le piden, también a remodelado su casa y esta alquilando todo el primer piso de su casa.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para compra de ropa y zapatos.
El préstamo ha ayudado mucho, ella ha podido salir, aprendió a trabajar con empeño para conseguir  sus sueños.   
El sueño de Tania escombrase una moto-car. Para darlo en alquiler y tener otra entrada mas para su familia.
texts.en:
Click here to see an earlier loan that Tania received through Kiva: http://partners.kiva.org/app.phppage=businesses&action=about&id=102248&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Tania is a member of the Divine Child Communal Bank. She sells new and used clothing, and she sells everything the customers ask for. She also remodeled her home and rents out the entire first floor. Tania needs a loan of 1,600 soles to purchase clothes and shoes. The earlier loan helped greatly. Tania was able to grow, and she learned how to work with purpose in order to achieve her goals. Tania's dream is to get a car to rent out and have one more source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.en:
Rosa has a small restaurant business selling barbecued meats and cold drinks on the weekends in front of her home. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Her husband is retired from his job with the Ministry of Agriculture.

Rosa has been working with Kiva's partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras." She used her very first loan of 300 soles to invest in a small amount of candy for sale. Nowadays, she has her business selling cold drinks and grilled chicken and other meats. Rosa reports that her business is progressing well. She hopes to use this loan of 2000 soles to invest in tables, chairs and tablecloths as well as more food for her restaurant.

Rosa's goal is to improve her restaurant and expand her customer base. She hopes to use the profits from her business to help her husband and children.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, tablecloths and food for a restaurant

loans.name: Kari

texts.en:
Kari is 25 years old and is married with no children. Her husband is a teacher. Kari dedicates herself to the sale of Ebel beauty products as well as clothing and shoes.

Kari has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 14 months and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras." Kari invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in beauty products for sale. Her business has grown since that time; she now invests not only in beauty products but also in clothing and shoes for sale. Additionally, Kari purchases materials to make hand-sewn beaded sandals for sale. Kari plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to invest in clothing (pants, blouses, etc.) and shoes for sale.

Kari's goal is to eventually have her own pawnshop.

loans.use: Clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old and is married with six children, two of whom are still dependent on her. She uses her loans to invest in two businesses: her husband's vulcanizing business (processing of rubber and other materials to strengthen them) and her own business selling candy, soft drinks, and cooked food.

Juana has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for four years and belongs to the communal bank "Las Doncellas." She hopes to use this loan of 1300 soles to purchase a sander and a compressor for her husband's vulcanizing business. Juana is a busy woman who invests much time in running her own business as well as in helping her husband with his.

Juana's goal is to eventually construct her own restaurant where she can sell her foods. Juana is pictured here next to the small food and drink stand that she has currently.

loans.use: Purchase of a sander and compressor for a vulcanizing business

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mrs. Sor E. is a married mother, 44 years old, who is blessed with six children. Three of her children are employed: two daughters work as seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a plantation worker.

Sor E. and her husband have their current business of fishing. On the other hand, this couple has always cultivated rice on their own farmland during the crop season. Recently, Sor E.’s rice crop, lacking fertilizer, is not growing after planting. She is therefore applying for a loan to buy more fertilizer to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor O., 38, is a modest mother who has two school-aged children. She is a domestic handicraft maker and uses the raw material, rattan, to weave into furniture for sale. In addition, her husband tries to generate money for their family’s daily expenses from fishing.

Besides their current work, the family has a farming business. Sor O. is taking out a loan to purchase a cow which she will use to plow the farmland and then will begin planting various crops. She proposes to raise the cow’s offspring in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a cow which she will use to plow her farmland

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So O. currently makes rattan furniture. She is 55 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, located about 200 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She has two children: one is married and one is single.

So O. saves up over 10 sets of rattan and then sells them to her customers for profit. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband helps her transport the finished products directly to customers' houses. Recently, So O. has run out of raw materials from her stock supply, so she would like a Kiva loan in order to buy additional rattans to better meet her furniture orders.

loans.use: To buy additional rattans

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en:
T. currently owns a vehicle which he uses to provide a transportation service, while his wife stays at home making rattan furniture to earn a living. In addition, they always plant a variety of crops during the farming season. T. is looking for a loan in order to buy a cow which he will use to plow a piece of farmland. He hopes to raise this cow for calving in the future.

T. is a humble man, age 42, married and the father of five single children: two of whom are employed in different jobs, while the others are students and dependent on his income. T.'s wife appears in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing farmland

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn O. is 43 years of age and has seven children: ages 8 to 17 years old. Merlyn's husband is a fisherman while she has been a plain housewife, nurturing and taking care of her family while her husband works hard to earn money for them. All of Merlyn's married life, she has been playing the role of plain housewife. However, as her seven children grow up, she's realized that the small income her husband is earning from fishing is insufficient to meet the needs of her children, especially for their education. Since Merlyn now has no small child to worry much about, and her older children can now be trusted to work on some household chores, she thought of starting a business.

Just a month ago, Merlyn joined a group of five women in her village to undergo training to become an ASHI member and have the opportunity to take out a loan. Her loan is intended for a business of buying and selling fish. Though Merlyn's husband is a fisherman, for the past two years, the owner of the fishing boat he uses, sells the fish caught to either him or his wife. He's only paid for his service, and for the many kilos of fish he's caught, at a very cheap price. That is why Merlyn's husband supports his wife's decision.

Having been trusted with business capital, Merlyn is inspired to grow her business well so she can borrow larger amounts from ASHI in the future. Her wish is that through her business profit, she will be able to attain her dream for her children –- a better education.

loans.use: Starting capital for a fish selling business

loans.name: Shamshad Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Shamshad Baji is a 29-year-old married lady, and has been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband, M. R., is an electrician who also sells electrical supplies to his customers. He has been involved in this business for the past 6 years. Shamshad Baji is uneducated, but she admitted her four sons into school because she doesn’t want to deprive her kids of the blessing of education. Shamshad Baji is a very hard working lady. She gets up daily at 5 o’clock and goes to the market to buy timbers for cooking food for her family. She is applying for a loan to buy electrical supplies (switches, electric wires and switchboards) for her husband.

This loan is consists of four additional people:

Azizan Baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell. Rafiqan Baji, Mumtaz Baji and Nasreen Baji all want loans to buy a donkey cart for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Shamshad Baji is seated first from the right in this photo.”

loans.use: To buy electric supplies to sell

loans.name: Rashida Muhammad Maqbool Group

texts.en:
My name is Rashida, and I am 45 years old. I have been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 15 years. I am an uneducated lady because my parents couldn’t send me to school due to the conservative environment of the community. I was married to M. M., but he died because of an accident 4 years ago. I was very much attached to him and it was difficult to stay strong. But I made myself strong for my kids.

I operate a sewing business to run my house, and my elder son is a rickshaw driver and helps me with the finances. Now my second son wants to be a driver like his elder brother. I have successfully completed a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan to buy another auto-rickshaw (a local 3-wheeled motor vehicle) for my second son.

This loan consists of 3 additional people: Amna wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Zainab wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell. Sharifan wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Rashida is seated second from the left in this photo.

loans.use: To buy another auto-rickshaw (a local 3-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Maqsoodan Muhammad Saleem Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is the wife of M. S. and has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Her husband runs a fruit and vegetable selling business. He treks to different communities and areas to sell his products in a loud voice on a donkey cart. He has been in this business for the past 2 years. Maqsoodan has no kids. She spends her time sewing clothes. Her activity gives her money, which she saves in a committee. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because the old one has become rough and rotted in different areas.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Sakina and Muniran each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

Note: Maqsoodan is seated first from the left in this photo.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette G. is 34-years old and has three children from three to ten years old. Her husband, Loreto, is a laborer.  Suzette runs a small business she started when she joined ASHI in 2008. Her business is going well but, since her  capital is still small, she is unable to grow her business and increase profits.  Due to the support of her loving husband, she repaid her first loan with ASHI on time giving her a credit rating of 100% . After paying her first loan, Suzette is requesting her second loan. This time, she plans to add cattle/cow fattening to her business. This involves raising a cow and selling it in order to have a back up in case of any financial difficulties. She hopes in this way to enhance her variety store and to increase her savings.

Suzette envisions that someday all of her children will graduate from college, she will be running a big general store and selling large volumes of many varieties of livestock in the market.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Teav

texts.en:
Teav V. is a 38-year-old married father. Currently he works as a community consultant clerk, while his wife sells various grocery items from their home. The couple married years ago and have three children, all of whom attend school and are dependent on their parents. Teav V.’s wife has recently sold all her stock, and she hopes to acquire more inventory so that she can continue selling. Therefore, Teav V. has decided to ask for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase various kinds of grocery items for his wife to sell. This will provide him and his family with extra income and a better standard of living.

Note: The photo shows Teav V.'s wife in front of the grocery store at their house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Nasir Masih Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar has completed 2 years with Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third time to buy animals (goats) to improve her husband’s animal-selling business.

She has been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 32 years. Her husband's name is N. M.. She has 4 kids: 3 daughters and 1 son. She wants to give her children a good education; that’s why she enrolled her kids in school and they all are in kindergarten.

This loan consists of 4 additional people: Shahnaz wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Shamim, Naseem, and Razia each want a loan to buy donkey carts for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Shamim is seated first from the right in this photo.

loans.use: To buy goats for an animal-selling business

loans.name: Nasreen Akhtar Muhammad Hanif Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Akhtar is a 44-year-old married lady and has been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is M. H., and he is a loader by profession. He loads different items such as construction supplies, fruits, and vegetables on his cart and delivers them to the required place. He has been doing this work for the past 2 years. Nasreen makes sofa covers and sells them to the market and earns income. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the money. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because her husband's old cart has become rough and rotted in different areas.

This loan consists of 4 additional people: Bushra wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Kaniz wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Kalsoom wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Yasmeen wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local 3-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Nasreen is seated first from the right in this photo.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading

loans.name: Samina Muhammad Irfan Group

texts.en:
Samina is the wife of M. I. and has resided in a city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the past 18 years. Her husband has been a rickshaw driver for 6 years. Samina is a very hardworking lady. She operates her sewing business to share the financial burden with her husband and to pay the utilities. Samina is a group leader of 3 other ladies. They all are very hardworking and independent ladies. They handle their own businesses to share the financial burden. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local 3-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband; currently he is driving a rented one and pays half to the owner.

Sakina wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Azran wants a loan to buy bicycles to sell. Asia wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Samina is seated second from the right in this photo.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local 3-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Pring

texts.en: Pring T. is a 39-year-old farmer. She is married with two children who both attend secondary public school. Her husband works in construction to help the family's finances. Pring T. wants her husband to set up in business as a taxi driver. She believes that such a business would be profitable and help her family meet its daily expenses. Therefore, Pring T. is requesting a loan of $300 USD to add to her savings in order to buy a trailer motorbike (Tuk Tuk) for her husband to begin running a taxi service.

loans.use: To buy a trailer motorbike (Tuk Tuk)

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia P. has been a member of Kiva partner, ASHI, since 2008. She joined this NGO because she wanted a loan that would make her dream of having a business come true. Her decision to join ASHI and take a loan was supported by her husband, a laborer and sometimes a charcoal maker.

In the village where Cecilia and her husband live, together with their five children aged from 1 to 22 years old, most families use charcoal for cooking food. These people are poor and are financially unable to buy electric or gas stoves. Therefore, Cecilia decided to venture into charcoal selling with the first loan she received from ASHI. After she had repaid her loan, Cecilia saw that she had made a good profit, and she was given a 10% credit rating (attendance rate, repayment rate and business rate) by ASHI staff, which means she qualified for bigger loans.

With this new loan, Cecilia wants to enhance further her charcoal selling business. She plans to buy a large volume of charcoal and negotiate with another vendor to be her supplier as well. With this plan, Cecilia is hopeful that her business will grow even more. She desires to send all her children to school until college, and hopes to be able to give them the life they should have.

loans.use: To buy a large volume of charcoal to supply other charcoal vendors in the village

loans.name: Sosan Muhammad Bashir Group

texts.en:
Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy material (scissors, clothes and thread) for her tailoring center.

Najma baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her clothes-sewing business.

Sakina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit to sell.

Sabra baji wants a loan to buy vehicle-repair tools for her motor workshop. 

Sosan baji, wife of M. B., has resided in the city of Vehari, Pakistan, for the past twenty years. Her husband runs a barbershop in the community where people come for a haircut and to get a shave. He has been running this salon for the past six years.

Sosan baji is a very cooperative lady. She operates a clothes-sewing business to manage the household needs as required. Her family feels proud of her. She is applying for a loan to buy items (scissors, hair dressings and creams) for her husband’s barbershop. Sosan baji is seated second from the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy material for her husband's barbershop

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk T., 43 years old, is a single mother of four children, three of whom are employed as domestic construction workers and provide their income to support their family’s living expenses. Ouk, a rice farmer, is requesting a loan to buy seed and fertilizer in order to grow a rice crop during this farming season. She thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer in order to grow a rice crop

loans.name: Wahedullah

texts.en:
ٌWahedullah is the son of G. H.. He lives in District 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan, and he is married with two children. ٌWahedullah has a tailoring shop in the city, and he needs a small loan for his business. He has requested an individual loan of 40,000 AFN to expand and improve his business. He wants to buy necessary materials and stock for his shop, and continue to work hard.

ٌWahedullah is very happy to have the opportunity of a small loan, and wants to thank everyone involved in this process, especially Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expand his business and buy materials and stock

loans.name: Murodchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Муродчону 30 лет, женат и отец 4-х детей. Занимается продажей мужской обуви на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова, а также ездит по районам Ашт и Лохути. Жена Муродчона домохозяйка. Она смотрит за своими детьми и делает домашнюю работу, а также откармливает домашний скот. Муродчон как глава семьи должен работать, чтобы прокормить свою семью, обучать детей и развивать свой бизнес. Муродчон закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Он ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Так как начинается школьный и осенний сезон, Муродчон  хочет закупить осеннюю партию обуви.
texts.en:
Murodchon is 30 years old, married and is a father of 4 children. He sells men's shoes at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov and also goes to the Asht and Lohuti districts. Murodchon's wife is a homemaker. She looks after their children and does domestic work, and also feeds livestock. As the head of household, Murodchon has to work in order to support his family, teach the children and develop his business. Murodchon buys his merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. He goes there twice per month. Due to the start of the school and autumn season, Murodchon wants to purchase a stock of autumn shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of autumn shoes

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Khalid Hussain Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar baji has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan, for the past 25 years. Her husband deals in timber and sells in the local community and other areas. He has eight years of experience in this business. Shamim baji is the leader of this group. The group members are very happy with her because of her good behavior. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy timber to expand her husband’s business.

Sajida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Zubaida khanum baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (eggs and breads) for reselling.

Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell.

Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: In this photo Shamim baji is seated in the middle of the bajis and is showing one of the member's groceries.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: M. is a 22-year-old mother of one lovely young child. She is married to Hean Korn, aged 25, who works in construction. M. is a local rice cultivator and she has also been hired by her neighbor to plant their new crop and harvest their mature crop. M. will use her loan to purchase an ox-cart in order to pick up the mature crop during the harvesting season. She and her husband are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To purchase an ox-cart

loans.name: Nor Aqa Group

texts.en:
Nor Aqa is the leader of the three-member Nor Aqa group. Each member would like to receive money for his own business in order to expand and improve it.

Nor Aqa and Mohammad monir want to take loans for their oil-selling businesses in order to improve and increase their trade.

Mohammad Sabar wants to take a loan for his taxi business in order to attract more customers.

The group send their thanks to Kiva partner AFS in Afghanistan, and to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
For the past two years Grace F. has been a member of Ahon Sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI), the first Grameen replicator in the Philippines that has given poor women the opportunity to discover their God-given skills in running a business by providing them with loans. Supported by her husband, a farmer, Grace took the opportunity in 2007 to borrow from the organization to start her rice production/planting business.

Although still small, the business has gone well for Grace and her husband, allowing them to frequently provide necessities for their children. Furthermore, Grace was able to pay back the loan on time, thereby qualifying for a larger loan from ASHI.

Happy to have been thus approved for a larger loan, Grace will use the funds to enhance her rice production business. Fortunate to have family-owned land upon which to farm, Grace believes that someday she will achieve her dreams for her children – a high level of education and a good quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as rice seedlings, fertilizers, pesticides, and to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Nasreen Abdul Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji and Shamim akhtar baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

Sakina baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Nasreen baji, wife of A. R., has resided in the city of Vehari, Pakistan, for the past twenty years. Her husband sells clothes and has been doing this for over eight years. He buys clothes from the markets of the city of Multan and sells them in his own city. The reason for buying clothes from Multan is the cheap prices and good variety.

Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business. Nasreen baji is seated the first from the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her husband's business

loans.name: Bashiran Muhammad Rafiq Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is married to M. R. who runs a timber-selling business in the city of Chichawatni, Pakistan. They have been citizens of this city for the past sixteen years. Bashiran baji is a very active and hardworking lady. She helps her husband by tying the pieces of wood together. They have been doing this business for the last eight years. Her husband chose this profession due to no gas being available in the community so that people use wood to cook their food.

Bashiran baji is applying for a loan to buy more timber to increase the profit of her husband’s timber selling business. In the photo, Bashiran baji is standing first on the right.

This loan consists of four additional people: 

Tahira baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Kanizan baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Lalan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy mason’s tools.

loans.use: To buy timbers for her husband's business

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Мукаддас 37 лет. Вдова и мать 3-х детей. Бедная женщина очень рано стала вдовой. Её муж работал в Российской Федерации и погиб в несчастном случае. До того времени Мукаддас нигде не работала, муж ей присылал деньги из России. Теперь бедная Мукаддас вынуждена работать сама, чтобы прокормить своих детей и копить деньги к их свадьбе.  Мукаддас занимается продажей детской и женской одежды на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Она закупает товар из оптового рынка города ИСТАРАВШАН. Мукаддас просит займ для закупки осенней партии женской и детской одежды, а также школьной формы.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mukaddas is 37 years old. She is a widow and is a mother of three children. This poor woman has become a widow too soon. Her husband was working in the Russian Federation and has died in an accident. Before that time Mukaddas has not worked anywhere, her husband sent her the money from Russia. Now poor Mukaddas has to work herself so she can feed her children and save money for their weddings. Mukaddas sells children's and women's clothing on the Favoron market in the town of Gafurov. She buys the merchandise at the wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Mukaddas is requesting a loan to buy a batch of fall women's and children's clothing and also school uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fall women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar Mahboob Hussain Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji has been a citizen of Chichawatni, Pakistan, for the past eighteen years. Her husband’s name is M. H. and he is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and has been driving it for the past five years.

Naseem baji is a very hardworking lady. She is working on a sewing machine in the photo. She operates her clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband and to pay the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw because, currently, her husband is driving a rented one and pays half the income to the owner.

This loan group consists of five additional people:

Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Sugran baji wants a loan to buy vehicle engine oil to sell.

Khatoon baji and Farzana baji each want a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell.

Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Shamshad Liaqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Shamshad baji is the wife of L. A. who has been residing in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband is a mason by profession, having experience for the past 25 years. He constructs buildings and earns income. When he gets orders to construct a building, he rents the tools and at the end pays back the rent to the owner. Shamshad baji is requesting a loan to buy masonry tools for her husband so that he can earn the entire income for his struggle.

This loan is consists of two additional people:

Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy items (woods, and nails) for her furniture making business. 
Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy mason tools.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Shamshad baji is seated in the first from the left in this photo”.

loans.use: To buy mason tools

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Матлуба женщина средних лет, ей 48 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей женской детской одежды на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Матлуба закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшен, она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в месяц, а иногда ей привозят товар её соседи по бизнесу, чтобы она не тратила лишние деньги на дорогу. Но сейчас она хочет съездить за товаром сама и привезти партию мальчиковой и девичьей школьной формы. Для этого она просит новый займ.
texts.en:
Matluba is a middle-aged woman; she is 48 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She sells women's and children's clothing at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Matluba buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She goes there 2-3 times per month, but sometimes her store neighbors bring the merchandise for her, so that she would not waste money for the road. However, now Matluba wants to get the merchandise by herself and bring in a stock of boys' and girls' school uniforms. She is requesting a new loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school uniforms

loans.name: Zuhra Ahmad Yar Group

texts.en:
Zuhra baji is a widow and has been residing in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 17 years. Her husband died in an accident. His death left an unforgettable impact on her brain. She still misses him in her life. Zuhra baji runs a grocery shop in the community. She started the grocery shop from her house because the rents are too high in Chichawatni. People come to her to buy groceries because of her fine items. She has been running this shop for the last eight years. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her grocery shop and earn a good profit. 

This loan consists of four additional people: 

Shazia baji and Hanifan baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. 
Farhana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 
Razia baji wants a loan to buy mason tools.
