This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: “Zuhra baji is standing second from the left in this photo”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Bibi Moheba Group

texts.en:
Bibi Moheba is the group leader of Bibi Moheba group. There are three members in this group. They requested a group loan of 30000 Afghani. They are very happy with this loan. 

Bibi Moheba wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to buy fiber and other things for her business. Jamelah wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. This is a new business she wants to develop.  M. Aref wants to take a loan for his general store to enlarge his shop.       
They all would like to expand their business through the loan they want to take and to support their families as well.

loans.use: To buy materials for carpet weaving

loans.name: Bilquis Muhammad Amen Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji is the wife of M. A. who has been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband is a farmer by profession. He takes land on rent and grows vegetables on it. He grows seasonal vegetables, sells to the vegetable market and earns an income. Bilquis baji is applying for a loan to take land on rent to advance her husband’s vegetable business.

This loan consists of four additional people:

Majeedan baji wants a loan to buy mason tools. 
Sajida parveen baji and Arshad baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. 
Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Bilquis baji is standing second from the right in this photo”.

loans.use: To buy land on rent for growing vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Seeds and tools

loans.name: Samera Group

texts.en: Samera is the group leader of Samera group, which has four members, each of whom wants to take a loan to advance and expand their business. Samera wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Bibi Shaeid wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a small restaurant. Bibi Habeba wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring and embroidery. Mustafa wants to take a loan for his bakery business. They are all very thankful to Kiva lenders who support entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Anorchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
    Анорчон - 26 лет. Недавно вышла замуж, детей пока не имеет, но она беременна и готовится стать матерью. Её муж занимается скотоводством. Анорчон занимается продажей женской и детской одежды на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Она не ездит за товаром сама, ей привозят соседи по бизнесу. Она заказывает определенный вид товара, на этот раз она заказала школьную форму и для этого просит займ. Анорчон хочет поработать хотя бы до родов, чтобы накопить деньги для расходов будущего ребенка.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Anorchon is 26 years old. She has recently married, does not yet have children, but she is pregnant is is getting ready to become a mother. Her husband does animal husbandry. Anorchon sells women's and children's clothing on the Favoron market in the town of Gafurov. She does not travel to buy merchandise, her business neighbors bring it to her. She orders a specific type of merchandise and this time she ordered school uniforms and is asking for a loan for this reason. Anorchon wants to work until she gives birth so she can save money for the expenses of future baby.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school uniforms

loans.name: Nabila Naz Abdul Hafiz Group

texts.en:
Nabila Naz baji, the wife of A. H., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for 18 years. She is a very hardworking lady. She operates a business sewing clothes. Her neighbors order from her because she is very committed and never disturbs the customer. She has been doing this work for five years. She saves her money in a committee fund and plans to renovate her house with her share of the committee fund. Her husband drives a donkey cart and uses this vehicle to deliver the items to the assigned place. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because the old one has become rough and rotted. 

This loan group consists of two additional people: 

Rubina baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 
Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy tea and milk for her tea stall. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Nabila baji is seated in the middle of the bajis in the photograph.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Zarina Abdul Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Zarina baji, the wife of A. R., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for 18 years. Her husband is a daily wage laborer and Zarina baji is a very talented and hardworking lady. She embroiders dresses and sews clothing, but unfortunately, she doesn’t have the resources to buy the items required to improve her skills. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes and earn income. 

This loan group consists of four additional people:

Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy beads, colored thread and clothes for her decorative embroidery business. 
Parveen baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools. 
Nasreen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. 
Razia baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Zarina baji is the first person on the left in the photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Seemen Group

texts.en:
Seemen is the group leader of the Seemen Group. Each of the four members of this group wants a loan to expand their business. They are requesting a group loan of 56000 Afghani. 

Seemen wants a loan for his tailoring business. Nasren wants to take a loan for her husband who is a painter. Fazala wants a loan for her husband who has a metal-working shop. G. M. wants a loan for his painting business. They are very happy that AFS and Kiva lenders that can support entrepreneurs from all over the world.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Хосият 50 лет. Вдова и мать 3-х детей. Хосият потеряла мужа несколько лет назад. Теперь она воспитывает детей одна. После смерти мужа Хосият стало трудно. Она должна много работать чтобы прокормить и обучать своих детей. Старший сын помогает матери по мере возможности, но у него своя семья. Хосият занимается продажей женской и детской одежды на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Так как наступает школьный сезон, Хосият просит займ для закупки школьной формы для мальчиков и девочек.
texts.en:
Hosiyat is 50 years old. She is a widow and is a mother of 3 children. Hosiyat lost her husband several years ago. Now she raises her children alone. It has become difficult for Hosiyat after the death of her husband. She has to work a lot in order to feed and school her children. Her oldest son helps his mother as much as possible, but he has his own family. Hosiyat sells women's and children's clothing at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Due to the beginning of the school season, Hosiyat is requesting a loan in order to purchase school uniforms for boys and girls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more seeds for his farm

loans.name: Shahnaz Muhammad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji, the wife of M. H., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for 18 years. Her husband drives an auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle) and has four years of experience in this profession. Shahnaz baji operates a business sewing clothes. She takes orders from her neighbors and earns income. She uses her income on necessities. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw, because its engine seizes. This loan group consists of four additional people:
  • Kalsoom Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.
  • Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.
  • Salamat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.
  • Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Shahnaz baji is the first woman on the right side in this photo. Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Riaz Khatoon Ameer Ali Group

texts.en:
Riaz Khatoon baji, the wife of A. A. has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for 18 years. Her husband is a mason. Riaz baji is a very caring lady. She takes care of every need of her family. She sells artificial flowersto pay for the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy masonry tools for her husband.

This loan group consists of three additional people:

Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy wires, switchboards and switches for her electrical supply business. 
Hina baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. 
Afzal baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Riaz baji is the second person from the left in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Хамраев Уктам    -ему 40лет, живет с семьёй из 3их детей, женой, которая помогает ему в семейном деле. Они занимаются производством национальных лепешек на дому, у Уктама огромный тандыр,где он уже более 15 лет печёт лепёшки и продаёт их на базаре. В основном продавцы сами приходят и закупают всю лепёшку, а бывает что жена Рохатой  сама продаёт на базаре.Уктам закупает муку и дрова по оптовой цене и наш кредит очень помог ему при закупке сырья.Он рад что обратился в нашу организацию за кредитом.
texts.en:
Uktam H. is 40 years old. He lives with his family of 3 children and wife, who helps him with their family business. They make traditional flatbread at home and then sell it at a market. Uktam has a huge tandoori oven that he has used for over 15 years to bake flatbread. Usually retailers come and buy all of the flatbread from him, and sometimes Uktam's wife, Rohatoi, sells it herself at the market. Uktam buys flour and wood at a wholesale price, and our loan helped him with this purchase. He is glad that he came to our organization for a credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and coal

loans.name: Alima Group

texts.en:
Alima is the group leader of the Alima Group. There are five members in this group. Each member wants a loan to improve their business and make it larger. Therefore, they are requesting a group loan of 70000 Afghani. 

Alima wants a loan for her embroidery business. Norui wants a loan for her husband who has a general store. Seyed Khnam wants a loan for her husband who has a car parts shop. Hanas G. wants a loan for her husband who has a general store. Mara G. wants a loan for her tailoring business. 

They say that Kiva has best loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tol

texts.en: Tol L., 49, has been selling little fritters from home for an income. She is a married mother blessed with six children. Four of her children are single and two are married in their own homes.  Another source of family income comes from her husband who sells rattan furniture. He buys furniture in bulk on credit from a handicraft maker and then uses his trailer to sell them door-to-door around the community. Tol L. thinks that her husband’s business is a profitable one so she has decided to seek a loan to increase the capital of his business.

loans.use: To increase the capital of her husband’s business

loans.name: Sakina Muhammad Saeed Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji, the wife of M. S., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for 18 years. Her parents didn’t send her to school due to financial problems, but her mother taught her the skill of sewing clothes, which she is now using to earn income. Her husband sells fertilizer to farmers and to the shops and earns income. Sakina baji is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer to advance her husband’s business. 

This loan group consists of two additional people: 

Rani baji wants a loan to buy fruit to sell. 
Bushra baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
 
Sakina baji is seated in the middle of the bajis.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Bashiran Muhammad Yaqoob Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is a widow who has been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan for 20 years. She is a very wise and brave lady. She handles circumstances very bravely. She runs a grocery shop in the community and earns income to run her house. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Bashiran baji is mentoring another woman, Zarina, who wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Bashiran baji is seated on the left side in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en: Radwan is married with two children aged 4 and 3 years old. He owns a small mini-market where he sells groceries. He established this business four years ago in order to have extra income for his family, especially after getting married and having children. In addition to the grocery shop, Radwan is an employee at an insurance company.

loans.use: To purchase products for his mini-market

loans.name: Kodir

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Рахимов Кодир-53 летний мужчина,имеет полноценную семью,3 их детей, жена домохозяйка. Занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота более 20лет на дому.Его жена  помогает ему по хозяйству и по откармливанию скота. Этой семье нравиться присматривать за скотом и получать прибыль за это. Откорм скота это хлеб семьи и Кодир продолжает своё дело по сей день. Следующий займ он хочет закупить еще несколько бычков и откормить их ещё несколько мес-в.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Kodir R. is a 53 year old man, he has a good family, three children, his wife is a housewife. He feeds and grows large cattle at home for more than twenty years. His wife helps him around the house and to feed the cattle. This family likes to look after the cattle and get profit from it. Feeding of the cattle is a daily bread of this family and Kodir continues his business till this day. His next loan he wants to use to buy several calves and feed them for several months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long R., 62, a dessert seller, is a single mother of five children, two single and the rest married. Four of them are working in different occupations (two are garment workers, one works for a publishing company, and another is a rice farmer). Without a vehicle, Long R. and her children find it difficult to travel anywhere, so she is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike which her children will use to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike which her children will use to ride to work

loans.name: Bizainab

texts.ru:
Бизайнаб торгует детской одеждой . Зимой  она торгует  куртками  и другой теплой одеждой.   Недавно  приехал ее  муж с России на  2 недели и ей придется сидеть дома ухаживать за ним.      Муж присылал  деньги с России , что и помогало ей поддерживать бизнес.  А теперь когда он   приехал  и привезенные деньги  потратят на дом и подготовку детей к школе.   
А Бизайнаб возьмет кредит  и поедет за товаром в Уратюбе.
texts.en:
Bizainab sells children's clothing. During the winter, she sells jackets and other warm clothing. Her husband recently returned from Russia for two weeks, and she has to stay home and take care of him. Her husband used to send money from Russia, which helped Bizainab support the business. And now that he came back, they will spend the money he brought back for the house and to prepare their children for school. Bizainab plans to obtain a loan and go to Utratube for the merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise

loans.name: Zamirahon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Замирахон - 37 лет, замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Бунафша, находящийся в районе Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Её муж занимается торговлей фруктами и овощами на рынке Панчшанбе. Дочка Замирахон собирается поступать в Университет, поэтому Замирахон должна накопить на оплату за обучение дочери до сентября. Замирахон собирается закупить партию школьной одежды и для этого просит займ.
texts.en:
Zamirahon is 37 years old, married and is a mother of 3 children. She sells children's clothing at the Bunafsha market, located in the Panchshanbe district in the city of Khujand. Her husband sells fruits and vegetables at the Panchshanbe market. Zamirahon's daughter is getting ready to go to the University, and this is why Zamirahon has to save money prior to September to pay for her daughter's education. Zamirahon plans to purchase a stock of school uniforms and is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school uniforms

loans.name: Ahmad Zabir Group

texts.en:
A. Zabir is the leader of the A. Zabir loan group. There are four members in this group. Each member wants a loan to expand her/his business and makes it larger. 

A. Zabir wants a loan for his taxi. Shkarui wants a loan for her husband who sells paint. Roaullah wants a loan for her husband who has a general store. Haren wants a loan for her embroidery business. Together, they are requesting a group loan of 40000 Afghani. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders who can support all poor people.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mamur

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Юсупов Мамур мужчина средних лет.У него семья  из 3х детей, жена  дома помогает мужу по откорму скота. У этой семьи  большой опыт по откармливанию и крупного и мелкого скота. Они каждый год закупают  скот в начале весны и целое лето пасут их на пастбище, после чего к осени когда они будут готовы продают их за хорошие деньги. На часть вырученных денег  он готовится на зиму, а на часть он закупает еще и скот.Недавно от своих соседей они узнали про нашу организацию и решили взять кредит.Мамур на полученный займ хочет купить дойную корову.
texts.en:
Mamur U. is a middle-aged man. He has a family of 3 children and wife, who helps him feed livestock at home. His family has an extensive experience in raising cattle and small livestock. Every year, they buy livestock at the beginning of spring and graze it all summer long, and once livestock is ready in the autumn, they sell it for a good price. Mamur uses some of the profits to prepare for the winter and some to purchase more livestock. Mamur and his wife recently learned about our organization from their neighbors and decided to obtain a loan. Mamur wants to purchase a dairy cow with this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Chet T. is a 27-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province. She is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle to make her family’s traveling easier. Chet T. currently raises pigs and cultivates rice to earn a living and her husband works in construction. This couple was married some years ago and they are blessed with school age children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Shahnaz Muhammad Ali Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji, the wife of M. A., lives in Borewala, a city famous for its shrines. She and her husband are a very hardworking couple. Shahnaz baji operates a carpet-weaving business and her husband sells the carpet collection in the market. In this way, they run their financial circle. Her husband feels proud and appreciates her and her struggle and effort for him and his family. She is applying for a loan to buy colored thread and tools for her carpet-weaving business.

This loan group consists of four additional people:

  • Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy colored thread, beads and clothes for her decorative embroidery business.
  • Nagina baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food-selling business.
  • Zuhra baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps, pipes) to resell.
  • Abida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling buisness.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Shahnaz baji is the first person in the row in this photo. Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy material for her carpet-weaving business

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат получает 2 раз  кредит. Он  рад что его дела идут хорошо. В прошлый раз он починил несколько машин. Его знакомый купил машину из Прибалтики и дал ему ремонтировать машину. Также переоборудовать машину на газовый аппарат. В основном он перекрашивает по желанию клиентов машины. Но на наших дорогах быстро выходят из строя  автомашины и работы ему хватает. Очередной кредит  получает на  покупки красок и необходимых запасных частей для ремонта машин.
texts.en:
This is Furkat's second time obtaining a loan. He is glad that his business is going well. Last time, he was able to fix several cars. His friend bought a car from the Baltic and gave it to Furkat to repair and to covert to gas equipment. Furkat mainly paints the cars according to his customers' requests. However, on our roads cars break down quickly, thus, giving Furkat plenty of work. He wants to obtain this loan to purchase paint and necessary spare parts for repairing cars.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint and spare parts

loans.name: Abdurafik

texts.ru: Абдурафик 1973 года рождения , женат имеет 3 детей.  Имеет среднее образование. Работает водителем такси в свободное время нанимается водителем грузовой машиныЗИЛ. В основном развозит тяжелые грузы.  У него есть заказы и рейсы по районам и городу.  Его машина устарела и требует  ремонта и конечно  больших затрат. Но получив кредит он отремонтирует только частично. И дальше будет делать  дальние рейсы.  Со временем от полученной прибыли он также закончит свой дальнейший ремонт.
texts.en:
Abdurafik was born in 1973, he is married and has three children. He has secondary education. He works as a taxi driver and drives a truck of make ZIL in his free time. He mainly transports heavy freights. He gets order on routs around the region and town. His vehicle has become old and needs a repair and of course the costs are high. By getting a loan he will make only partial repairs. And then he will be able to make long hauls. With time he will finish the repair when he makes a profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Moun

texts.en: Moun S., 52, is married and lives in Battambong Province with her two children. The family's primary source of income is generated by her husband, a construction foreman. Although the current world financial crisis has hit Cambodians hard, his business is still healthy because, with adequate construction tools, he is able to provide good and fast services to his customers. The family is also supported by one of the children who is a construction worker. Moun is asking CREDIT for a loan of $600 to purchase more construction tools for her husband's business. (Her husband is presented in the picture because Moun was not available)

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Sai

texts.en:
Sai S. is a 43-year-old woman who lives in the town of Battambong Province. She is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Sai owns and operates an agricultural business whose main activity is raising crops. Planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sales is the main, but not the only, source of income. Sai has been engaged in this business for over 24 years and she earns approximately US $45 a month.

In 2009, Sai joined CREDIT to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This is Sai's first loan request from CREDIT and she is asking for a loan of US $800. The loan will be used to invest in starting a new business of selling groceries. Sai plans to use the additional revenue generated from the new business to supplement the family's income.

About CREDIT:

CREDIT's mission is to provide inclusive financial services tailored to the clients' needs through excellent service and positive relationships while maintaining organizational sustainability.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan K., 43, has rented a place outside the market where she sells a variety of fruits for daily income. Her husband, Hem Pouy, 61, assists her, as does a school-aged son when he is not going to school. Although the enterprise is profitable, to generate a larger daily income Kan needs to improve her business but lacks the capital to do so. She would therefore like a loan to order different kinds of fruit to sell.

Note: The picture shows Kan K.'s husband at the selling place.

loans.use: To order different kinds of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say H. is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Battambong Province. She is married and has three children: two of them are students, while the other one is a farmer. Say owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Say has been engaged in this business for over twenty-four years and earns approximately US$45 a month. In 2009, Say joined CREDIT to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Say is requesting for the first time a loan from CREDIT. She is requesting a loan of US$800 which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CREDIT: CREDIT's mission is to provide inclusive financial services tailored to the clients' needs through excellent service and positive relationships while maintaining organizational sustainability. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying animals for his land

loans.name: Muhabatkhon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Мухабатхон 56 лет, замужем и мать 4-х детей. Мухабатхон - портниха, она шьет платья а ее дочь продает их на рынке Джума-базари Якшанбе-базар города Худжанда. Мухабатхон шьет женские национальные платья из разных тканей. Она закупает ткани из рынка Атуш и Сомон. Там ткани на много дешевле чем в других рынках. Мухабатхон собирается закупить ткань "велюр" для осеннего сезона. Уже с сентября станет немного прохладно, и все женщины начнут носить платья из велюра. Для этого Мухабатхон просит займ.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Muhabatkhon is 56 years old, she is married and is a mother of four children. Muhabatkhon is a seamstress, she sews dresses and her daughter sells them on the Djuma-bazar and Yakshanbe-bazar in the town of Khudjand. Muhabatkhon sews women's traditional dresses from different fabrics. She buys the fabrics on the Atush and Somon markets. The fabrics are much cheaper there than on other markets. Muhabatkhon plans to buy velour fabrics for the autumn season. Starting in September it will become a little colder and all women will start wearing dresses from velour. Muhatatkhon is requesting a loan for this.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy velour fabrics

loans.name: Ona

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Абдурахмонова Она-Уроженка Джабаррасуловского района, молодая женщина 26 ти лет, со средним образованием, имеет 3их детей и хорошего мужа. Её муж Суюнов Абдулазиз вместе со своей женой торгует на базаре сельхоз. продуктами на местном рынке. У него большой ассортимент продуктов,  которых они закупают у дехкан по низкой цене и продают за приемлимую цену. Наш кредит помогает им тем что за наличные деньги они закупают товар подешевле, а своих средств им не хватает, поэтому они работают с нашей организацией. Им это нравится и в дальнейшем они намереваются   продолжать с нами работать.
texts.en:
Ona A. was born in the Jabbar Rasulov district. She is a young, 26-year-old woman, who has secondary education, 3 children and a good husband. Her husband, Abdulaziz Suyunov, and his wife sell agricultural products at a local market. He has a wide selection of products that they purchase from farmers at a low price and resell at an acceptable price. Our credit helps them because they use the cash to buy the products cheaper and do not have enough of their own means. This is why they are working with our organization. They like this and plan to continue working with us in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of onions

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou K. is a 30-year-old man who lives with his wife (pictured at her farmland) in Battambong Province. He has three children: two of them are students, while the other one is a beer seller. K. owns and operates a construction business. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately US$105 a month. In 2009, K. joined CREDIT to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting for the first time a loan from CREDIT. He is requesting a loan of US$300 which will be used to purchase a motorbike. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About CREDIT: CREDIT's mission is to provide inclusive financial services tailored to the clients' needs through excellent service and positive relationships while maintaining organizational sustainability. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch N., 35, is married and has a two-year-old child. He lives with his wife in Battambong province. He is a construction builder who commutes from place to place to find a construction site on which to work. He typically is able to generate an income of US$3.50 per day as the primary source of income to cover his family’s expenses.

Global financial problems have hit many people hard. These economic struggles have forced many people to cut back on expenses and to find ways to save money. N. and his wife see an opportunity to cut back on the repair expenses of his old motorbike through the purchase of a new motorbike. He and his wife have approached CREDIT for a loan of US$700 to purchase a new motorbike that will allow them to save more money and to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike and some construction tools

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Non T. is 44 years old, married, and a good mother caring for three teenage children. One of them is a firewood seller and the others are students. Her husband sells firewood that he cuts from the forest. Non T. is a vegetable grower.

After she had grown her vegetable crop one month ago, she faced a problem with her crop which was not growing well because of the lack of fertilizer. Because of this obstacle, she is taking out a loan to buy four sacks of fertilizer and will use it to expand her crop yield.

Note: Non T. was not available for photographing, so her husband appears in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sakina Muhammad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji, the wife of M. H., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 18 years. She is not an educated lady because her parents couldn’t afford the education expenses, but she has proven herself through her cloth-selling business. Her business plays a vital role for her household because, with it, she is able to pay for utilities. Her husband is a carpenter who makes furniture on order. This time he has nothing to display in his shop to attract customer. Sakina baji is applying for a loan to buy woods, nails and wooden polisher, so that he can make furniture and gather orders from customers. This loan group consists of three additional people:
  • Noshaba H. baji wants a loan to buy iron, scissors and designs for her tailoring shop.
  • Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps, pipes) to sell.
  • Salma baji wants a loan to buy wires, switchboards and switches to resell.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Sakina baji is seated in the second from the right in this photo. Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy material for a furniture business

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Iv L., 44, is married and has four children: two of them are students and the rest are construction workers who typically earn US$ 2 per day. He lives with his wife in Battambong province. He is engaged in working in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer on his own plot of farmland. He is also a motor-taxi driver who usually provides his transportation services in his village and some nearby markets.

Iv L. typically is able to generate an income of US$ 4.50 per day as a primary source of income to cover his family expenses. His wife (pictured) operates a grocery store at her home with an income of US$ 5 per day. Global financial problems have hit many people hard. These economic struggles have forced many people to cut back on expenses and to find ways to save money.

L. and his wife have found an opportunity to increase family income by starting another business for his wife as grocery seller. They have approached CREDIT for a loan of US$ 250 to purchase groceries that will allow them to save more money and to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing more groceries for resale

loans.name: Bouy

texts.en:
Bouy K., 39, is married and lives with her three young children in Battambong province. She is engaged in a business of producing a kind of traditional Cambodian cake. She also sells vegetables and fish, so she is able to generate an income of US$ 5 per day all in all. Her husband operates a motor-taxi and makes around US$ 3 every day.

They have recently noticed that their motorbike is not holding up well, and they need to purchase a new one to maintain their income. So, K. approached CREDIT to request a loan of US$ 800 to replace their old motorbike. They see this as way to increase their daily income through saving funds that are not used on repairs.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike for use as a motor taxi

loans.name: Naseem Muhammad Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji, the a wife of M. A., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 19 years. She is a very hardworking lady. She operates a business sewing clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. Since she is a very supportive lady, she also did this work to help her father before she was married. Her husband is a fruit merchant. He buys fruits wholesale and sells to the fruit shops. He also treks to different areas to earn income. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her husband’s fruit business.

This loan is consists of three additional people. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy frozen chickens to sell. Bilquis baji and Shamim baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Naseem A. baji is seated first from the left in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth K., 27, is married and lives with three children in the Battambong province. She is engaged in the sewing business, making US$ 3 each day, while her husband (pictured) operates a motor-taxi by providing his services at the local markets, making about US$ 5 each day.

A financial crisis has played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these difficult times, Muth K. is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to invest in the agriculture sector. She wants to grow fruit trees and various kinds of vegetables on her own plot of farmland in the hope that she will be able to generate additional revenue for her children's education and family use.

loans.use: growing fruit trees

loans.name: Asia Muhammad Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Asia baji, the wife of M. A., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 20 years. Her husband is a butcher and runs a shop where he sells chicken. He has 5 years of experience in this business. Asia baji is a very supportive and talented lady. She has a business decorating handmade fans. She purchases fans in the market and, after decorating them, she sells them in the community and other areas to earn income. She is applying for a loan to buy more chickens to expand her husband’s chicken business. This loan group consists of four additional people:
  • Shahida baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell.
  • Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy medicine to sell.
  • Najma baji wants a loan to buy vehicles spare parts to sell.
  • Muniran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle).
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Asia baji is seated second from the right in this photo. Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chickens for a chicken business

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn U. is married and lives with two of her children. She works as a farmer in Kampong Cham province, typically making US$ 2 each day, and her family is supported by her two children who are currently working in a local garment factory.

Her husband (pictured) is engaged in the agriculture sector as a farmer. Besides working as a farmer, he also climbs palm trees to collect palm juice and sell it to his repeat customers. By doing these two jobs, he is able to make collectively an income of US$ 3 per day. U. wants to take a loan of US$ 800 to purchase fishing implements, and with remainder, she wants to improve her farming business by purchasing more fertilizer and seeds to produce more output for this rainy season.

loans.use: purchasing fishing implements

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad inherited this shop from his father who established it 15 years ago. The shop is located in the center of Arabah village, and it is owned by Mohammad and his brothers, but since they are busy at their jobs, Mohammad is fully dedicated to managing this business. In addition to the shop, he has some goats and has planted vegetables; he sells these products in his shop. 

Mohammad appears in the picture at his shop.

loans.use: Improve shop decor and purchase new products for the store

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S., 56, is married and has 6 children. She currently lives with husband in Kampong Cham province and she is unemployed. However, the family is supported by her four children who are working in the city at a garment factory. Her children are able to send her money of US$150 per month to cover her expenses. Her husband is a traditional musician who performs at wedding parties and he typically is able to make US$0.8 per day. S. and her husband have recently noticed that their motorbike is not holding up well and they need to purchase a new one to maintain their income. She has requested a loan of US$250 from CREDIT to replace their old motorbike so that her children are able to go to work. S. sees this as way to increase their daily income through funds that will no longer be needed for repairs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Thirty-one year old Jerlyn B. is a rice farmer and is married to Carlito B.. She is worried about how to get along with the finances in their home. All she wants to do is to grow her crops and be able to send her four children to school.

She is asking for a loan of Php 13,000 from CEVI. She will use part of the loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals. She will also use some of the funds to pay her children's tuition.

Now that she has been actively involved in the CEVI cluster meetings, she has received not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals and pay childrens' tuition

loans.name: Loubelle

texts.en:
Loubelle A. is 26 years old and the mother of one child. She makes her living from the farm that she and her husband have tilled since they were married. They grow rice and from it they are able to earn income to provide for the family's growing needs.

The purpose for her loan of Php 13,000 is to buy fertilizers, chmicals and rice seeds. She and her husband have been working all day long on their farm to ensure that they can have an abundant harvest.

Actively participating in the CEVI program, she receives many benefits, such as loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, chemicals and rice seeds

loans.name: Razia Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Razia baji, the wife of R., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 20 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Her husband sells fruit and has 8 years of experience in this business. He buys the fruit wholesale and sells it to fruit shops. Sometimes he treks to different areas to sell from a cart. Razia baji is a very caring lady. She readily helps him by arranging and packing the fruit. She is applying for a loan to buy fruit to increase the profit of her husband’s fruit business. 

This loan is consists of four additional people. Shahzad baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. Najma K. baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy scissors, a mirror and chairs for her barber shop. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Razia baji is seated second from the left in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Vanh

texts.en: Mr. Vanh S. is 39 years old and his wife, Seng Phan, is 37. They work from home making furniture which they also sell. Most of their output consists of beds, tables and cupboards, which they accumulate and sell as sets. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. The couple has four children, all of whom are in school and (when school ends for the day) help their parents make furniture. In order to increase his income, Vanh S. has applied for an $800 loan to buy a piece of machinery that he can rent out to his neighbors when they want to plow their fields. In the photo, we see Mrs. Seng Phan. Mr. Vanh S. was not available when the photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine which he will rent it out to nearby farmers

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
"We earn our income from the rice field that we till. Because we are very familiar with the process of farming, it's no longer difficult for us to grow rice and manage our business to support our children," says 31-year-old Rosie A., who is the mother of two children. She knows about CEVI's credit services and would like a loan of 13,000 PHP to be able to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides for her farm. These will go far to increase the size of her normal harvest.

Through small loans, CEVI helps people's small businesses grow. They provide their clients with – not just loans – but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Taj Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Taj baji has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 20 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Taj baji is a very talented lady. She makes and sells parandas, an ornament that women use to tie back their hair. Her husband, M. R. helps Taj baji by selling her parandas in the market. They each have 6 years of experience in this business. Now she is applying for a loan to buy thread and beads to expand their paranda business. 

This loan group consists of four additional people. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy vehicle tires to sell. Shamim baji wants a loan to repair her truck. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Taj baji is seated second from the right in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is a rice grower from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is 30 years old and has two children. She says she is lucky because, aside from having a good rice farm, she has a very hardworking husband who is always supportive of her.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and chemicals. This loan will really help her achieve a better harvest and increase the income for her family.

She is participating in the CEVI cluster meetings. She has learned many things from their training; she receives credit and education. CEVI provides insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Эшонкулова Фотима- 40летняя молодая женщина, семейная женщина. У неё 3е детей, муж-Дадабаев Кузибой занимается откормом скота на дому, также в свободное время помогает жене закупать товар и продавать на рынке. Часть своего  товара они получают со своего земельного участка, а часть покупают у дехкан. Фотима получает хорошую прибыль от этого бизнеса и довольна нашей организацией, так как получив кредит она расширила свой товарооборот
texts.en:
Fotima A. is a 40-year-old, young, family woman. She has 3 children, and her husband, Kuziboi Dadabaev is involved in raising livestock at home. He also helps his wife buy products and sell at a market in his free time. They get some of their product from their plot of land and buy some of it from farmers. Fotima makes a good profit from this business and is pleased with our organization because she was able to increase her product turnover with a credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Pauline Andeso

texts.en:
Pauline, married, is mother to three school-aged children.  She sells second-hand clothes at her kiosk in the neighborhood of Manyatta, outside of Kisumu, Kenya. She has been running her business for two years, and says that things are going well. She really wants to purchase some new clothes, for her business, with her loan proceeds (some imported items from Dubai). Her dream is to someday become a wholesaler so that she can sell in bulk to retailers in the area. She says that she has regular customers, but that her profit margins are small on the common, local goods that she currently has.  

In addition to running her business, Pauline takes care of three children who were orphaned when her sister passed away two years ago. She also works as a community health worker with K-MET, the field partner giving her the loan.  She works two days a week, visiting the sick, offering basic services, and running errands for those too sick to take care of themselves.  She also educates her peers about important health issues and best practices.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khursheed Rasheed Group

texts.en:
I have been living in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. My husband, R., has a shop where he sells bicycle wheels. He has been in this business for the 7 years. I am applying for a loan for my husband to expand his bicycle wheel business.

I would like to request a loan for my group so that they can also establish their businesses. Nasreen baji wants a loan to repair her rickshaw. Farzana baji and Shamim baji each want a loan to buy a rickshaw. Another woman named Shamim baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Khursheed baji is seated in the center of the bajis in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bicycles wheels to sell

loans.name: Frankline Awino

texts.en:
Frankline owns and operates a small restaurant kiosk (called “hotels” in Kenya) where she makes fresh chapatti, rice, and chips. She also sells fruit and sodas. Her shop is known at “Mama Japuony’s” by her regular customers due to the fact that her 9-year-old disabled son, Japuony (meaning “teacher”), is known in the community. Her older son, who is 18 years old, needs her financial help as he tries to finish secondary school (high school), and Frankline says that it is a challenge to pay his school fees.  She also has 5 children who are grown and out of the house.  

Frankline has faced many challenges in her life and in her business. Currently, the rising food prices in Kenya are affecting her profit margins. She cannot fully pass on the increased costs to her customers since they are unwilling to pay much more for her meals. This comes after Frankline rebuilt her business in early 2008. The post-election violence in Kisumu, at the end of 2007, resulted in her kiosk being burned to the ground. Still, she has her mind set on success. She takes some goods to sell wherever she goes, hoping to find business along the way.

loans.use: Goods for her food shop.

loans.name: Salma Liaqat Group

texts.en:
I am Salma and I have been living in Borewala, Pakistan for 20 years. My husband, L., has a business selling chicken in the market. He has been in this profession for 5 years. I am applying for a loan to buy chicken for my husband’s business.

This loan group consists of two additional people. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
 
Salma baji is seated in the center of the bajis in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chickens for a chicken business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
51-year old Lorna P. is a farmer and mother of five children. She says that she started her business when she just young. Her farm really helps her family in paying the school fees and paying the expenses for their household. Now, as children have already grown up, she is still managing a rice farm to support their needs.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and chemicals. She is very hopeful that buying all the farm necessities will, in turn, give her family a bountiful harvest. 

Actively, she participates in the CEVI credit program. She receives, not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi Group

texts.en:
Allah R. baji (seated center) has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and runs the financial circle. Allah R. baji makes cloth bags and sells them in the market. She purchases cut pieces of clothing for cheap rates and makes bags in different designs. She earns a good income and saves it in a committee for future house renovations. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s rickshaw because it's not functioning well and maintenance is necessary.

This is a group loan, and the group has two additional members:

Shahnaz B. baji wants a loan to buy a rickshaw. 
Farzana baji wants a loan to buy sugarcane for her sugarcane syrup selling business. 

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: M. Ruth, 37 years old, is hard working lady and the leader of Kibuye United group in Mubende. She is a farmer and, at the same time, a business lady. She is involved in the sale of produce that she buys from fellow farmers, in addition to what she gets from her own farm. She has been operating her business from Nyabuhula village for 6 years and, at the moment, she is able to make profits amounting to 400,000 UGX a month. She also buys goats and sheep for resale. The good quality of her animals and other produce attracts more customers to her business. Ruth has a dream of buying a car that will help in transporting her goods. As well, she dreams of constructing a family house for her 5 children, aged 4 - 14 years, and the 2 dependents she cares for, all still in Primary school. This is Ruth’s 20th loan with her lending group and she is grateful for the journey she has taken with the help of these loans. She needs a loan to help buy more goats for resale as well as buying more seeds and employing laborers on her farm for further improved outcomes.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale, more seeds and towards employing manpower on farm.

loans.name: Manzooran Muhammad Rafiq Group

texts.en:
My name is Manzooran and I’ve been a citizen of the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. I am married to M. R., who lives in our community. He has 10 years of experience selling clothes. It’s a very profitable business because people are fond of wearing new dresses. I am applying for a loan to buy more clothes to advance my husband’s business.

This loan is for four additional people: Khursheed Baji and Shahnaz Baji each want a loan to buy bicycles to sell. Jamila Naz Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Sugran Baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies for reselling. Manzooran Baji is seated in the center of the bajis in this photo.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Rashida Ashfaq Masih Group

texts.en:
Rashida Baji runs a parlor in her house to meet expenses. She is a wife of A. M., who has resided in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband is a government employee earning meager wages. She is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics and a hair dresser for her parlor. Rashida Baji is standing, first from the left, in this photo.

This loan is for two additional people: Bashiran Baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for a beauty salon

loans.name: Fozia Shahri Group

texts.en:
Fozia baji, wife of S., has resided in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, for the past twenty years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband works in a factory on monthly wage. Fozia baji is seated on the right in the photo.

Fozia baji is a very talented lady and she has a dream of making a tailoring center in the community where people approach her to have clothes sewn. Presently, she has a sewing machine but she wants to buy another sewing machine to make her dream come true.

This loan group consists of two additional people:

Rubina baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Гаффоров Шавкатжон-мужчина ,28 лет – женат имеет одного ребёнка, его жена  Махмудова Мукаддас воспитывает своего ребенка на дому присматривает за хозяйством. Шавкатчон занимается торговлей более 12 лет. Его хлеб за этот счет . Он продаёт овощи и фрукты по сезону и заказывает товар поставщикам. Он узнал о кредитовании по наслышке и решил  попробовать. Сперва у него был маленький ассортимент и после первой выдачи его дела резко пошли на улучшение,так как Шавкатчон уже стал закупать большую партию товара. Теперь он благодарен нашей организации за предоставленную поддержку.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Shavkatjon G. is 28 years old, married and has one child. His wife Mukaddas Mahmudova raises their child at home and takes care of the household. Shavkatjon has been doing retail for more than twelve years. He earns the daily bread. He sells fruits and vegetables which are in season and orders the produce from suppliers. He found out about the loan program by a word of mouth and decided to try it. At first he had a small assortment and after the first loan his business has drastically improved because Shavkatjon has began to buy in large quantities. Now he is grateful to our organization for the support it provided.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en: K. Juliet is a determined and hard-working, 36 year old mother of 2 children. She also cares for 2 more dependents. Juliet is a tailor with a tailoring business, that has been running since 2000, in Igorora town. She helps mend her clients’ new and used clothing at a fee and her good service has enabled her to stay in business for all those years under tight competition. She is able to make 160,000 as profits per month. Juliet hopes for more business expansion and she hopes to be in position to buy more new clothing materials for display in her store and also to have a happy family with all basic needs at their disposal. This is Juliet’s 4th loan and she hopes to expand and develop in business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for her business' expansion.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en: Kareem K. is 30 years old and married. He has a shop where he sells VCDs. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 nairas to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Olushola

texts.en: Olushola is 42 years old and married with four children. He sells engine oil. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more engine oil to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. is 41 years old and married with four children. She sells planks retail to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more planks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Samya

texts.en:
Samya is a single woman working with her brother in managing this business; they have a big shop at Ya'abad Village selling kitchen equipment and accessories for the house. Since her brother is an employee she spends her time at the business till noon, when her brother comes to stay at the shop. They want to buy a container full of house equipment so they approched FATEN for the loan.

Samya appears in the picture at her business

loans.use: To buy home products for resale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. is 56 years old and married with two children. He sells and repairs fridges and air conditioners. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase a generator as an alternative power supply for working. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Freda

texts.en: Freda sells drinks and food. She does business with the assistance of her mother who is always giving her a helping hand. She is 29 years old and single. With the demand for drinks, she is requesting a loan amount of N40000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Gafor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Махмудов Гаффор-49 летний мужчина со средним образованием ,женат имеет 4х детей.Занимается куплей-продажей скота уже много лет, но у него ещё есть и другой семейный доход-у него автомашина марки Газель которую он запустил на рейс и в среднем  его доход составляет 500 сом. в месяц.Его основным делом является бизнес скотом. Он закупает скот со всех рынков района и на базарный день продает за хорошие деньги.За скотом присматривает его жена Санавбар, корм  он не покупает так как он выращивает на своем участке.Гафор работает с нашей организацией и получает выгоду,так как за наличные деньги он покупает скот подешевле и он благодарен нам.
texts.en:
Gafor M. is a 49-year-old man, who is married and has 4 children. He has secondary education. He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for many years, but he also has another small source of family income. Gafor owns a Gazel vehicle, which he placed into shuttle service. This business brings in an average monthly income is 500 somoni. However, his primarily activity is the livestock business. He buys livestock from all the district markets and resells it for good money on market days. Gafor's wife, Sanavbar, looks after the livestock. He does not buy livestock feed since he grows it on his own land. Gafor gets a benefit when he works with our organization because he can use cash to purchase livestock cheaper. He is grateful to us.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
25-year-old Rosalie M. is a rice grower from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has one child and her only wish is that she could own a farm so that they could provide better for all their family needs. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer, rice seeds, and gallons of chemicals. She has a strong feeling that that by buying all of these things, she will be able to increase the size of their harvest.

Now, she is connected with the CEVI credit program. She has received not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Kazeem

texts.en: Kazeem is 32 years old and married with 2 children. He is a fashion designer. He is requesting a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase tailoring materials. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is 39 years old and married with 3 children. She is a fashion designer and also sells provisions. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah A. is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She sells eggs and ice blocks. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more eggs and a deep freezer. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and inventory

loans.name: Tola

texts.en: Tola O. is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She sells crates of eggs. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Djalal

texts.en:
"Dear friends! I am Djamil's brother. I am very thankful to you, that you helped my brother to improve his business." He applied for a loan in 2007 from Kiva and repaid it very successfully.

You can see in the picture Djamil H.'s brother Djalal. Now Djalal is applying for a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his cattle breeding business.

Djalal was born in 1966. He is married and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, settled in Finnish houses that are built temporarily on the front line in the Fizuli region.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She has a salon where she styles hair for her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Oluwaseun
